It is nearly across the street from downtown Disney and DisneyLand.   The hotel is clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. While the hotel might look a bit dated, everything worked. the pool was kept clean.   Shannon at the front desk was very helpful and allowed us late checkout. Breakfast was good and hot - eggs, sausage, toast, bagels, yogurt, juice, apples and bananas.   I knocked off a star on the rating because there was an issue with the resort fee, which does not show up on the reservation confirmation. Parking was easy.  You can walk to Downtown Disney in less than 15 minutes... and it is an easy walk.  Another 5-7 minutes and you're at the gate of the Disney Park.  Breakfast was decent.  I can't imagine a better value for a Disneyland trip.

At 8:30 there was no eggs, 1 1/2 piece of sausage, no donuts what so ever, only 1 waffle maker available of the 2 there and no inside seating. We had to handle our food and drinks with a door we had to open and get outside - no automatic door The original room given to me was on the 2nd floor but I could not negotiate the steps with luggage etc do to a very resent back injury so the very nice, tall gent at the front desk in the evening, did some switching

The previous occupants had covered the smoke detector with a polythene bag, and the general smell of marijuana around the place made it clear why. We left before breakfast, so I can't comment on that. The staff were friendly, and the room was clean. Unfortunately it was just a bit scary all round.

Summary: This room will do if you spend all your time at Disney or else where.  It's close by and the staff is really helpful and friendly.  Amy and Carlos did a great job in telling us about the buses to and from Disney and the Angels game.  I like big rooms so that was the only thing I did not like I felt I was tripping over my own stuff.

Check in and out was fast with friendly service. The room met our needs with a comfy bed and plenty of pillows. Morning breakfast provided a nice start to the morning, however the dining area is small and cramped. Not sure what is included with the $12 per day, resort fee. Guess it's cheaper than paying for parking at the parks. Overall a nice stay.

I arrived just after 3pm. Check-in was quick and easy. Front desk staff were friendly and welcoming.  Room allocated (232) was clean and decent size. Obviously an older property but I was happy with the quality of the bed, linen etc. Room also had air conditioning/heater and a small fridge and a coffee maker. The room also had a small balcony on the street side. I felt safe, even with no secure corridors. Summary: This hotel is everything you need if going to Disney with your family. I would not stay here for any other purpose. The rooms are basic but comfortable. There is a fridge and microwave, plus breakfast in the mornings. We walked to Disney/California adventure. There are a handful of places to eat in the area that are off Disney property so you can actually have a meal without dropping tons of money. We were here to sleep, shower and that was it, it worked for us. The staff was very helpful and nice. You can buy your tickets for Disney at the front desk, saving yourself a wait in line at the park.  There are plenty of other things to spend your money on at the park don't waste it on a fancy room you won't spend any time in.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: A cheap hotel in walking distance to Disneyland is what this is. The staff were friendly, the room did have a microwave and mini-fridge, and there was a small pool and hot tub but we didn't use those so I can't comment on them. The beds were uncomfortable, and the wi-fi was okay the first night but after that did not work at all. Because of this we had to last minute add an international cell phone data plan onto our phones so that was frustrating. There is breakfast included which is why we picked this place but it wasn't anything spectacular. A waffle iron was the highlight and some fruit but otherwise the usual dry cereal, juice machine and donuts/muffins.  Overall it was okay, mostly because it's just so close to walk to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: I would look for better and closer

I will say the room was very clean it was quiet it did have a small swimming pool that I did not use kind of a quaint little hotel with a Denny's right across the street but I think for a few dollars more you could be in a lot better situation

Breakfast is all you would want, a good range (waffles, fruit, toast, cereal, bagles etc) and always a table available. Major bonus is that Denny's is next door for dinner later! :)  Spa and pool were a dream after long days at Disneyland.   Couldn't recommend this place more! Will definitely be back. :D

So a room, like ours, with two small queen beds in it, leave little room for four people to be standing at the same time without being in each others way. The wife needed to use a scooter that we rented from APPLE SCOOTER of Anaheim and the manager let us keep and charge it in the lobby.

Breakfast is served every day which includes cereal, pastries, eggs, sausage, waffles, and beverages.  Overall, it served my purpose which was to stay within walking distance of Disneyland and the price was competitive to hotels nearby.  I would stay here again as long as the price is competitive because most hotels in the area are similar in many ways and you're paying for convenience to Disneyland.

Summary: Went to Anaheim for a convention, and let me just say even though I couldn't early check-in, the service was AMAZING! There were no rooms available yet (I came in about 11am, check in is 3pm) the woman at the front desk told us we can still change clothes in the bathroom to freshen up. She answered all of our questions about the area and was so helpful. When we checked in it was a shift change, a gentleman working the front desk was just as nice. Asked about the convention and the check in was so fast I was in the lobby for less than a minute. Rooms was clean, breakfast area was nice with seating. Would stay here again.

(Room 110)  The shower was good - The bed (the only one I used) was ok and the pillows were good.  It was moderately clean, more time spent in the bathroom (floor and shower needed more attention).  The TV had good channels - it was a flat screen, but no HD.    ****There is a $10 per night charge for Parking  Food: Next door is Denny's.  Walking distance to many restaurants.  And of course Downtown Disney is a short walk away.  Running:   You have so many options, the sidewalks are wide and you have so much to look at while you run.  I often will run the 2 mile loop of Katella - Right on S.Walnut - Right on Magic
Manager Response: I am very pleased to hear that your room provided plenty of space for you during your stay. Our last night there the little spiders started coming out in the room not sure how many we got rid of but gave me the chills to sleep there that last night.  Wifi is terrible and could not get a connection most of the time.
Manager Response: I am sorry that you did not enjoy your stay with us.  I have scheduled extra pest control this week to eliminate the spider situation that you described.  I know that must have been awful for you to experience and can assure you that this is the first incidence.  I have been informed that it is because of the heat since we have never had the problem before. Thank you for bringing these issues to my attention.  I would like to add that I have spoken to our maintenance about the condition of outside and have been assured that there will be more attention paid to the property. I hope that you will understand that we have addressed your issues and continue to stay with us for your visits to Anaheim.

Summary: I've stayed here before and enjoyed my stay. It is a clean, cute and convenient place to stay. The wifi was not all that hot the last time, but I was only going to be here for one night so it really was not an issue. This time I an here for 4 nights, as I'm here on business, I really needed the wifi. I do carry a personal Hotspot for me to use for work, but unfortunately I have forgotten it. I am trying to get my work done and the wifi is making it impossible. I really hope the next time I'm here the problem will be adressed. Still a very cute, clean and convenient place to stay. But like I said, the wifi needs serious help.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for bringing our wifi problem to my attention.  I have been assured that the connection issues have been resolved and will continue to monitor the situation.   Many of our guests are here for business and we know that the wifi  is extremely important.  We want this to be a stress free stay and are working hard to make this happen.   As you mentioned that you have stayed with us in the past, you know that this is not an issue that we usually have.  We look forward to seeing you again.

If you want something new with a magical Disney feel, this probably isn't the place. It is a good place to rest and get ready for your day. We would stay here again no question! Staff was also very friendly. (Carpets are old and kind of gross but honestly we just wore shoes. The rest of the room was very clean.)

Felt safe walking back after midnight. Motel seemed older but room was clean. Breakfast has a little more than continental but enough to get you out the door and there are several restaurants within walking if you want more. Room had microwave and good size refrigerator. Good enough for just sleeping and we spent 16 hours at Disneyland. All the hotels within walking distance are pricey for what you get.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  When you stay with us you will always have a refrigerator and microwave in your room.  We also have free parking for 1 car per room.  Most of the hotels in the area are charging.  We also let you park before you check in and until midnight on the day of check out.  We know that this is important to our guests and we will continue to provide this service.  We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary: WOW! My teenage daughter and I had a WONDERFUL stay here.  Breakfast was constantly filled and hot and our room was wonderfully clean and quiet! Parking was perfect nearly in front of our room! Yes, it is an older hotel but it was what the two of us needed.  We will be back!
Manager Response: It is always a pleasure to have return guests and we look forward to seeing you again.  Thank you for your review.

Summary Heading: Good location and sufficient for price

Breakfast was nothing special but it beats the outrageous prices Disney restaurants are charging. The front desk people were extremely nice and even let us park our car at the hotel before the check-in time so we can go to Disneyland for the day.
Manager Response: We are happy that you were able to take advantage of our parking policy.  You can even park here until midnight on the day you check out.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Room is quite basic but as you are probably going to be spending most of the day at the parks its exactly what you need. Bed is really comfy, Dennys is right next door so you are never peckish. Free breakfast is served in the (small) lobby. Staff are very helpful and friendly, offered free parking which was a huge plus for us. This hotels big perk is that it is literally a 5 minute walk away from Disneyland-no transport is supplied but believe me you do not need it. We used the pool on the first day as we arrived late afternoon-its small but as its only frequented by a few quests at a time it is all you need.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  One of the biggest draws to our hotel is having a pool.  It is quite funny though because it rarely gets full.  As you said, most people are going to the parks and only swim for a few minutes.  Our pool is heated and sparkling clean.  I have been tempted to jump in myself!  Maybe the next time you come you will be able to go for a longer swim.  I look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: This hotel did its job. Stayed here for one night before heading to San Diego. Location is nice. The front desk people were nice and efficient. The only thing I wasn't too crazy about was the floor. We had a room on the second and sometimes I felt like the floor was going to break. Other than that, everything was good. Didn't try their breakfast, but it seemed to draw a lot people.
Manager Response: I am sorry that you did not have the opportunity to enjoy our buffet breakfast.  It does draw a large crowd because of our hot items that most hotels do not.  When we have groups we will find out their schedule to advise our guests of the busiest times to come.  This has avoided crowds and seems to work.  Hopefully for your next trip you will have the opportunity to come join us.

So relaxing on vacation is pretty much out the window if an alarm is required.
Manager Response: I am sorry that you did not have an enjoyable stay.  Our breakfast hours are from 6 AM until 9:30 AM. Again, I apologize if you did not have a chance to enjoy it.

Summary: We stayed at this Quality Inn for several nights in June 2015 during our first visit to Disneyland. We didn't know what to expect but we're very happy with the price, location and the room and other amenities.   We weren't looking for a pricey luxury hotel. We basically needed an affordable, clean, safe place to stay as close to the Disney parks as possible. This was a great choice.   It is an old hotel, which really added to its charm as being an early Disney area hotel. It has been updated, and the pool area and courtyard were very nice. The room was clean and roomy. And for the price, it couldn't be beat. The breakfast was included and saved us a lot of time and money.   After all we were there to get into the Disney parks as fast as possible and to have a nearby place so we
Manager Response: none

Summary: The beds are super comfy and the breakfast has a variety for every palate. The staff is super happy and helpful. The decor may be worn with love but who stays in the room all day? There's a nice pool and hot tub. The walk to Disney is not too bad.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not too bad for a night stay
Summary: Just stayed here last night due to a conference at the Anaheim convention center.  The check in desk was very friendly and easily handled the tax exempt status of my stay.  Wifi was very very slow but I did find a twc wifi spot to connect to.  Breakfast was ok.  There is a Denny's very close to the motel.  The pool area is small but nice and clean.  There are sketchy looking apartments nearby thus all the signs about surveillance cameras and "for customers only"
Manager Response: none

Summary: Leaving today, already booked to come back in December. This is a great no frills hotel. It is definitely not the Ritz, but if you're looking for a safe place to sleep that's walking distance to the parks here it is. The value here is the location, friendly staff, and the breakfast! Oh the breakfast,  I have never seen so much variety at a complimentary breakfast. I would give this hotel 5 stars except for the musty smell when we walked into the room and the tiny pillows. We ended up going to target for a bottle of fabreeze and a couple cheap pillows, problem solved.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We decided to do a quick, out of the blue, two day trip to Disneyland. Didn't want to spend a lot of money on hotel room. We chose this hotel because it met this requirement. Simple accommodations that was equal to value paid. Free continental breakfast was simple but provided enough food to fill us up.
Manager Response: none

Summary: First time there and will be back. It is located directly opposite the Disneyland pathway to the entrance (at the traffic lights) - in fact if you stay at a Disneyland Resort onsite it actually takes you longer to walk to the main gates than this place did - we timed it! it looks more like a motel than hotel, its a little out dated BUT it was very clean, very comfortable, very spacious and very cheap. I stayed with two friends so we requested the 2 bedroom suite which had 2 queen size beds - two in one and one in a separate room. The bathroom and kitchenette were more than fine and both rooms had a TV. Free breakfast daily - mixture of cereals, pancakes/waffles and more. Basic pool, did the job, but I wasn't in Anaheim for a resort I was there for Disneyland. No complaints and
Manager Response: none

Summary: Clean and comfortable rooms with free parking. It is well located with only a short walk to Disneyland. Close to eateries and shops. We stayed for 4 nights in a upstairs room facing Disneyland. We were able to watch the fireworks from our room every night. It has good free WiFi and an average complimentary breakfast. Would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: would definitly stay again tho the wifi was little to non exsistant :(
Summary: it was a great clean hotel, walking distance to disneyland under 10 minutes. good choices at breakfast, good pool and hot tub and a nice little playground was a great surprise. plenty of free parking. ice machine to fill up the water bottles before you head to the park each morning. ect. will stay again, tho they need to fix the wifi. it only worked on some of our devices and was very patchy. worse wifi at any hotel we have ever stayed at. however, GREAT pillows, very updated and the shower head was actually tall enough for the average tall person :)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: They did not guarantee our room
Summary: Booked this room through my choicehotels account.  Guaranteed  our room until 7 am next day.  When we arrived, they sold our room and had no other rooms available.  They said they called earlier to say we needed a valid card on file because the one on our account was expired.  We were not available to answer the phone.  They didn't care.   We had to spend the next hour scrambling around Anaheim to find another room.  Lousy service,
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very affordable given the Area. Close to Disneyland and also the Anaheim Packing District. We stayed here on the 2nd floor. Place was nice and clean, but we found it a little more difficult having to get to the floor by means of elevator as the stairs were a bit farther off. Service was ok and room had all the essentials, but there was one small snafu. Gf noticed a big spider on the ceiling which frightened her and when I mentioned to the front desk morning person, he just shrugged it off. Otherwise, a decent stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good enough, we wanted this location for Run Disney
Summary: Booked three rooms for the Disneyland run Labor Day weekend for our party of six.  In the past, We have stayed all around Disneyland including all three Disney hotels.  First time at this property.  We chose this location to be close to Paradise Pier for the start and finish of the Disney runs, and honestly all other, 'better' hotels were booked.  This was the best available. The rooms varied in size but we were happy to have adjoining rooms, one with three queen beds!  Rooms were clean enough and our stay was pleasant.  Some of the electrical outlets need replacing and a few did not work.  It is nearly a one mile walk from the hotel to the theme park gates but doable.  Front desk employees were very helpful and cheerful.  Breakfast was better than expected.
Manager Response: We appreciate you choosing to stay with us for this years run.  We are working in the rooms now to make the necessary changes to provide our guests with updated amenities such as additional electrical outlets.  We are also working on changing some of the furniture.  We hope that in the marathons to come you will decide to look into staying with us.  We are always happy to have new guests stay with us and become one of our many repeat guests.  And don't forget, we will always have some breakfast ready for the runners early in the morning.  We look forward to seein you again.

Summary: This is a very average MOTEL, located in a high traffic tourist area. If Disneyland was not located nearby, this place would be a 1 star. The breakfast room is very small and part of the lobby. Not more than two families would be comfortable at one time. The breakfast was OK. The staff was not any more than average. The management should recruit some excellent staff to make up for the short comings. I do not normally write bad reviews, but this is definitely worthy of an exception an exception.
Manager Response: I am sorry that you did not enjoy your recent stay with us at the hotel.  We try to offer something for everyone during breakfast and usually have good reviews.  We would have loved to hear any suggestions that you might have had.  We hope that in the future you decide to give us another chance.

Summary: Pro:  good location, 10-15 minute walk to Disney, 3 miles from Angels Stadium, staff was very nice, rooms were clean, make your own waffles at breakfast  Con:  rooms were old, breakfast as a whole just ok, pool was small, door to the balcony didn't open  Very good rating is for a 2-Star Hotel, if you're looking for a 3 Star or greater hotel you won't be happy here.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a few moments to share your opinion about your stay with us.  We hope to be able to make the necessary updates to the hotel that will bring your opinion of us up to at least a 3 star.  In the comming months we have plans to update the furniture in the rooms and all of the maintenance that we were not able to complete during the summer months.  We know that you will find us even more comfortable on your next visit.

Summary: decided to try this hotel based on price, location is ok about 25 min walk to Disney, Breakfast was not very good, Microwave Sausage, Eggs, Frozen Doughnuts. the rooms were actually pretty comfortable updated and clean, customer service was great though, but based on what others run I would stay elsewhere
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is in an excellent location for disneyland,  about a 10min walk. Brilliant facilities, comfortable bed, full size fridge, microwave, air con. Everything was very clean and the staff were very friendly. We didn't try the breakfast so can't comment on it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: It was amazing. Breakfasr better than what ither hotels serve. The pool is great and so r the bathrooms. Recommend  many people to come here and stay. Tv us great with the channels and so is the view of the city
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff was excellent, but the hotel is a bit run down & dirty. It is not worth 150.00 per night, for sure. We stayed here for one night as a fill in to our Disney hotel reservation, but wish we would have booked sooner so we could stayed in a nicer place.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is better equipped to host families. Breakfast is plentiful. The lighting in the room is very poor, and not enough outlets for phone and computer connections. The internet connection is poor, keeps cutting out on me. To beat the long walk to Disney, you can cut through to Disneyland Drive and enter through hotel to arrive at Downtown Disney. I usually love Choice properties, but this one , not so much.
Manager Response: none

Summary: one our two week road trip this was one of our favorite hotels !! mainly because of the fantastic location to the theme parks !! it is less than a 10 minute walk from the hotel, the staff were all fine and the rooms were great nice big spacious rooms with a beautiful pool and spa to sit around till 10 pm !! was such a relaxing hotel for the 2 nights we were there and i cant go on about the location enough it is perfect for all you disney lovers like us !!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great staff. Close to Disneyland. Comfortable beds. Clean rooms. Refrigerator and microwave in the rooms. Free WiFi. Nice location. Free parking. Good continental breakfast. We have stayed here numerous times.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Inexpensive and decent place to stay for a Disney trip. When you only go back to sleep, a perfect place to stay. Clean and staff is very accomadating. Top it off with a nice continental breakfast everyday and free wifi to boot. A shork walk through Downtown Disney to the park. We took an airport shuttle and saved on a rental car.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: That they would offer a room that bad
Summary: First, the staff was nice about this problem which they are likely not in control of.  Even though I had reserved some time ahead, all they had was a room on the street parking lot.  This busy street was guaranteed to be loud.  But when I got into the room, it smelled like an old mop closet, was dusty all over, the toilet did that thing where it refills every 10 minutes because the tank is leaking, the sink was dripping and the air conditioner (or jet engine based on the noise) smelled like it was filled with gym socks.  After 20 minutes of this I went back, got a refund and found a different hotel.
Manager Response: I apologize for the condition of the room during your short stay.  We are working hard to get work done on the rooms and will send maintenance to check all of the issues that you had during your trip.  When visiting the area in the future please call me personally and we will make sure that you receive a management discount.  We know that we have a good reputation for our rooms and hope that you understand that this is not something we hear about everyday.

Summary: A pretty decent accommodation for the family with kids. Right at the heart of city. Small play area for kids is a bonus. I didn't use the pool and jacuzzi, but they looked pretty decent. Complimentary breakfast is also good, with waffle on the menu.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking time to respond online about the hotel.  We hope that on your next trip you will be able to enjoy the pool.  We hope that trip will be soon.  Thank you again.

Summary: Family Vacation!!! This was a great place to stay! There was 5 of us and got the extra bed, it made it a little cramped for space but we were not there to just stay in the hotel. The free breakfast was well worth it! Got us ready for our day in Disneyland! The walk into the park was 20 to 30 minutes. Well worth not having to drive and park then take the tram. Will stay here again.
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback from you and look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: Stayed here last minute for the Star Wars Weekend at the convention center. The room was clean and mostly quite. Breakfast the next morning was fresh and hot. The genlteman that checked me in was polite and offered to help me carry my bags up the stairs since there is not an elevator at this hotel. which was a great help!
Manager Response: Thank you for sending us your review of the hotel.  We enjoyed the convention probably as much as our guests.  We hope you will continue to visit us and participate in all of the craziness that these events bring.  We look forward to seeing you again, maybe in costume?

Summary: We stayed here May 16th through 20th 2015. We had 2 King rooms that faced the little park area. Loved the rooms, very nice. The windows faced the parking lot and we were ground level. It is at the very end of the Resort area and behind it are apartments, of which their garages face the hotel. One night could hear music being played in the garage, just for a short time. One night could hear occupants above me, not sure what they were doing but sounded like they were renovating, ha. We did not report either occurrence, was no big deal. Could see fireworks from outside hotel, watched them one night. Staff was great, friendly, helpful. We actually checked out the night before we left since we were leaving at 3am with no problems, left keys in the room. Breakfast was enough to start
Manager Response: On behalf of the entire staff at the Quality Inn and Suites I thank you for the generous review.  Our staff work extremely hard to make our guest experience something nice to remember.  It is for reviews like yours that we work as hard as we do.  Thank you again for the compliments to our hotel and staff.  We hope that your family is able to return soon.

Summary: everything you need in a hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room small but clean and quiet. Pool and hot tub clean and not crowded. Breakfast good. Stores, restaurants and Disney close by.  I have no complaints.
Manager Response: We are very pleased to hear that your stay was enjoyable.  We work hard to make all of our guests stays memorable and if there is anything that you could think of that we could improve upon we would love to hear back from you.  Thank you for staying with us and we hope that we will be seeing you again.

Summary Heading: Good for families with small children on a budget
Summary: The hotel is in a great location for Disneyland visits. The Anaheim Resort Transportation bus picks up next door and is very reliable, easy to use and you can avoid renting a car. A 3 day pass was $12 for adults and $5 for seniors.  Breakfast was included and  choices were eggs, sausage, waffles, donuts, fruit, cereal and breads. The coffee was fresh and great tasting.   The pool area was clean, they have little playground with slide and picnic tables. The hibiscus bushes were blooming and beautiful. The courtyard is well lit with beautiful landscaping.   The room was large with desk, chair, comfy overstuffed chair, armoire. In room coffee, safe, large bathroom very clean and good lighting.  The bedding was very comfortable. The air conditioner worked extremely well.   The
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving us a review.  We appreciate the feedback and use this information whenever we are planning changes to the property.  I apologize about the sun coming through your window in the morning and waking you.  Unfortunately that is something we have not been able to solve.  We will continue to work on this and try to come up with something that does not include curtains or shades. Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: Stayed here this weekend for a Disneyland trip, no complaints. Had the two queen suite, as the king room wasn't available. Room was decent sized and clean. Bathroom was clean also. The window IS in a weird place but it really wasn't that big of a deal. Make sure you keep the bathroom door closed unless you like to blinded by the sun as it rises though. Couldn't connect to the WiFi, but we didn't spend much time in the room anyway, so I didn't mention it to the desk.  The hotel is literally across the street from Disneyland, so it's my new favorite place to stay. If you walk in to the park through Downtown Disney, it's about a 10 minute walk. Save yourself the hassle and $15 and just walk.
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving us a review.  We appreciate the feedback and use this information whenever we are planning changes to the property.  I apologize about the sun coming through your window in the morning and waking you.  Unfortunately that is something we have not been able to solve.  We will continue to work on this and try to come up with something that does not include curtains or shades. Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: Nice motel near the Disneyland parks. Recommend entering the parks through the Grand Californian Hotel, rather than walking around to the main gate.  The room was decent for the price. Interesting, dated colors - but a good value for the price paid. Staff was nice. We had problems connecting to the free wi-fi on the chrome browser, fixed when we downloaded dolphin browser instead.  Our toilet clogged within 20 min of checking in, probably was clogged before we got there because we did not put it through heavy use (if you catch my meaning)... Staff brought up a plunger and we got to plunge it ourselves. Ok, fine with me, but odd.  Also odd was the fact that we did not have a fan in our bathroom. We did have a window, which was at eye-level to passersby on the motel hallway. So,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write your review.  We only have a few bathrooms with fans in them.  Most have the window.  If you would like a room with a fan on your next trip be sure to ask for a room in the front.  I'm happy that the rest of your trip was pleasant.  We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: We recently stayed here four nights while visiting family.  Booked this blindly thru a Priceline pick so got a great price for a decent hotel.  It isn't the Ritz, but I didn't expect it to be.  It was clean, staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  It was close to Disney and restaurants.  I had trouble with the wifi at first and they suggested moving to a different room.  Once we did there were no issues so if you want a reliable connection be sure to let them know.  They had a free breakfast every morning with waffles, bagels, cereal, hard boiled eggs, sausage, yogurt, etc making it an even better deal.  I would definitely book again.
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving us feedback about your recent stay with us.  I apologize for the lack of an internet connection in your first room.  We have been working on this issue and hope to have it resolved soon.  We are usually able to fix the problem when it is brought to our attention but we thank you for being understanding.  I hope that changing rooms did not inconvenience you.  We hope that you do not let this issue prevent you from returning to stay with us.  We would love to see you again.

Summary: The hotel is well located, a short walk to the parks and restaurants such as Denny's. Supermarkets and Walmart were also nearby. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The room itself was slightly dated but comfortable and clean the onsite laundry facilities were convenient. The included breakfast was a nice inclusion as was the parking. The free WiFi was unusable at times but was acknowledged and rectified by staff. Overall the stay was very pleasant and a great base for a Disney trip.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review of our hotel.  We appreciate you sharing the information regarding our location and how close we are to the Disney parks.  When looking at a map we seem a little far when actually we are across the street from the Disneyland Hotel.  I hope that you took advantage of the shortcut through Downtown Disney and rode the Monorail into the park. It helps cut down on the constant walking a little. Thank you for staying with us and we hope that you continually choose the Quality Inn for your trips to Anaheim.

Summary: Stayed only one night to attend an event at the Convention Center.  Room was pretty clean, the bed was very comfortable, staff was very friendly and the price was great for a Saturday night.  The front desk clerk even let me borrow her umbrella to walk to the Convention Center which saved me from not only getting wet from the rain, but also saved me $12 for parking at the center.  I only have one negative to note which I really hate to do because my overall stay was wonderful.  When I turned on the lights in the room in the evening, you could see white stains on the bed cover which looked like someone had tried to wipe off.  Not sure what those stains were, but kinda icky. :)
Manager Response: I cannot apologize enough for the condition of your bedspread.  I can assure you that we clean the room thoroughly each day unless a guest puts the do not disturb sign on the door. I can only assume that the white on the spread was bleach that splattered during laundering.  I hope that your trip was not ruined from this event.  The new bedding is already ordered so we will not have anymore issues.   I want to emphasize that our front desk staff is here 24 hours and we are always ready to take care of any problems that you might have. I hope that you experience does not prevent you from staying with us in the future.  I hope to see you coming back often.

Summary Heading: Great Location, Good Service, Clean Rooms
Summary: I stayed here for 1 night with family on new year day. Fantastic location - walking distance from disney park - so works better when you are tired walking in the park all day. Bed, Bedding quality is good, sleep quality is great, pricing is reasonable. Breakfast was at tiny place with not much choice - so we walked across the street to Denny's. They also have swimming pool, small children's play area. If you get a good deal - just go for this.
Manager Response: I am  happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  I am sorry that the breakfast area was too crowded for you.  We offer additional seating outside and also allow the breakfast to be taken to the rooms.  I hope that during your next stay you decide to enjoy what we offer for breakfast. Thank you for leaving your feedback.

Summary: We were looking for quality accommodations at a reasonable price, which is not always easy during the Christmas holiday.  This Quality Inn is small, and the room we had was a bit small, but the price was also not large for a stay at Disneyland during the holidays.   Front desk staff people were friendly and extremely helpful.  The outside appearance of the hotel is a bit garish, but the room was nicely furnished and clean.  (Beware:  This is one of those Choice Hotels that has the mini half-size pillows!  If not for that, I would have rated it five circles.)  Breakfast was definitely good with a nice selection.  (They even had skim milk for cereal as an option.)  Wifi worked very well.  A vent fan in the bathroom would have been nice.  The hotel has a small laundry room with one
Manager Response: We appreciate your comments.  We definitely offer larger rooms.  Each one of our rooms is a little different. We have guests that find their favorite and request it every time.  If you are not happy with the room that you are given at check in we will be happy to show you some alternatives.  Your comfort is important to us and we will do everything we can to provide for your needs.  We recommend that if you have any special requests to do so at the time the reservation is made. All of our guests are important to us and if we can plan ahead of your arrival we can make you stay more enjoyable.  Please come stay with us again.  We are happy to share our new pillows that are larger than before!

Summary: Walking distance from Disneyland.  Restaurants, grocery, gas etc nearby.  Hot tub not working but overall a decent and inexpensive stay.  Breakfast had hot waffles and pretty good selection.  Had a balcony room so we had a door on one side and a balcony overlooking the pool on the other.
Manager Response: I am sorry that our hot tub was having issues during your visit..  We have had some problems with the heater but have since resolved the issue. These things happen from time to time and we work to get things running as quickly as possible.  There are times when a part needed has to be ordered and it takes a day or two.  I know that this excuse is not something that is going to help when you are on a vacation and you only have a short time to use the pool or hot tub.  I hope you understand that these things cannot be predicted. It sounds like the rest of your stay went well.  I hope we can count you as one of our guests who will return to us year after year.

Summary Heading: Okay place to stay for the price
Summary: Choose this hotel based on cost and within walking distance to parks. Breakfast was in a tiny space located in the lobby, with about four or five tables. Was about a fifteen minutes walk to Downtown Disney , at the end was the entrance to both parks. The weather was too cool to use the pool and hot tub,they looked okay.  I'm glad we got the park hopper tickets, as the parks are right next to eachother, we got fast passes at one park and went back and forth'. Denny's is right next door, and we ate at Downtown Dismey a few times.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your stay with us.  We hope to be able to "wow" you on your next trip to the Parks.  We have been working hard on upgrades since you stay with us.  Please come back and let us show you all we have done.

Summary: This hotel is well priced, good location to the convention center and Disney and has breakfast. The best thing about this hotel is that the staff is really friendly. They go out of their way to make you feel welcome and at home. I think this is excellent value !
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our hospitality.  With so many hotels in the area we know that we must provide the atmosphere to keep our guests coming back.  We are able to get to know our guests and provide excellent customer service better than the larger hotels.  We try to talk to each and every guest during their stay.  We are all available to assist in making travel arrangements or suggesting tours to make your trip hassle free.  We hope that you will stop by the front desk during your next stay so we can help in any way we can.

Summary: Excellent front desk service. Great location to Disneyland Resort. Rooms are old and could use a refresh but everything was clean and working and sufficient. Breakfast was also good. Will stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for acknowledging our staff and their service.  We have been making many improvements with the rooms.  I am sure that our new carpet has helped to freshen them up.  Please come by and enjoy all we have done on your next trip to Anaheim Ca.

Summary: Excellent Location outside of Disneyland! The breakfast was ok - had a big enough selection to feed everyone's tastes.  The room was nice and spacious and had a big bathroom.  We stayed here for 3 nights comfortably.  There is a Denny's next door which stays open late and is an excellent choice for a quick meal after a long day at the park.  The hotel was nice and quiet as well.
Manager Response: Guest feedback is always appreciated.  We know that it takes time to leave your comments and would like to thank you for doing so.  We look forward to seeing more of you in the future.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel and Staff, super friendly and helpful
Summary: Went here December 2013. As a solo traveller for the first time I was nervous about going to the hotel. When I arrived the staff were super friendly and moved me from an outside room to a more safer room which I greatly appreciated. The staff were super helpful with all my queries and request and made my experience a very enjoyable one. Breakfast is really good and the walk to Disneyland is alright but there is also a bus that you can catch that goes straight to Disneyland. I would definitely stay here again!!!
Manager Response: It has been a while since you last stayed with us.  Since then we have added so many more lights around the property that I'm sure you will feel safe staying in any one of our rooms.  We have always considered the property safe, but with the added security camera and lighting you will be sure to feel the same. We hope that you are ready to come back to California to visit and stay with us again.

Summary: Nice and close walk to Disney.  The breakfast was decent.  The rooms are OK and beds were comfortable.  My only real gripe is the bathroom does not have exhaust fan, so the room got very humid when taking a shower. There is only a window you can open to get the shower humidity out.  The problem is the window is open to the outside hallway what everyone can see in.
Manager Response: Thank you for your concern about the bathroom issue.  We have fans in a few of the rooms downstairs in the front.  You can request these at the time you make your reservation.  We do not have any plans to install additional fans to the other rooms at this time.  We take all suggestions seriously and will talk about solutions when we plan our next upgrades.  Thank you for staying with us and I hope you will be happier with one of our rooms with a fan.

Summary Heading: Great service! Friendly staff! Close to parks!
Summary: Will definitely be staying here again in the future. While the rooms could use some updating, it's overall the best hotel in the area for the cost. The kids loves the pool and the breakfast hit the spot every morning.
Manager Response: I would like to invite you back to see what we have done to the rooms since you have been here last.  I am sure that you will be impressed.  We hope to see you really soon.

Summary Heading: Great value if you're on a budget.
Summary: This is a very good hotel for the price. The rooms were small but otherwise very clean. There's a picnic area and a swimming pool with an honest to goodness deep end. This made for a great place to relax. Staff are very nice and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for your nice review of your stay with us.  We still have the pool with the deep end that you enjoyed so much.  We have even been adding some flowers in that area to make things more relaxing.  It's been a while since your stay and we hope that you have another vacation planned soon and choose to stay with us.

Summary Heading: I can tell they are working on it, but yuck!
Summary: We stayed here 4 nights last week during our Disneyland trip.  It's too far to walk on sore feet!  The ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) is $5 per person per day, so not so economical and you have to call a cab if you miss that last bus!  Anyway, we buy our Disney tickets through AAA and get free parking with our rental car.  So the distance doesn't bother us but other guests mentioned the long walk and looked ragged coming back.  You could tell that the place had been recently painted on the outside, in the front at least, and they were doing some upgrades, like adding granite to the shower.  But the filthy rug with the black stains was so gross you barely noticed the new stuff.  Wear socks on the room or your feet will be black by the time you get across the room.  The socks are
Manager Response: I am sorry that this response has taken so long but I was reading through and saw yours was not responded to.  I would like to say that the carpets in all of the rooms were replaced recently.  The sink is gone that you mentioned.  We have made sure that we clean the playground everyday after we clean the pool.  I'm sure you would feel more comfortable now that these things are completed.  We hope that you give us another chance to show that we are putting alot of effort into fixing things that our guests point out to us.  Let me just say that your suggestions count.  We listen and are trying.  We look forward to seeing you come back.  Thank you for your useful suggestions.

Summary Heading: Best Hotel in the area for the Price
Summary: I take the Family out to Disneyland at least every few months. We have tested a lot of the Hotels in the area. I have a party of 6 ages 8 to 17. So that means I need bigger than a standard room. This Hotel is great. Big rooms. Really friendly staff. Great prices. Great free breakfast. And it's a short walk to Disneyland and the Anaheim Convention Center we always walk and it's not bad at all even when we stay till closing at Disneyland (midnight). So that saves on parking. I don't even look around anymore, I just call here and make the reservation. It's a 2 star hotel or so, that feels like a 4 star not by the way it looks it could use an update (carpet/paint) but by the feeling and support you get from the entire staff.
Manager Response: Thank you for such a kind review.  We love being able to accommodate for special requests when we are able to do so.  We are so happy that you continue to stay with us during your trips to Disney with your family.  We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This is an older hotel that has been taken care of. The prices are very reasonable and the location is great. The breakfast is better than most of the free continentals. They include some hot items like little sausage and egg patties, plus you can make your own waffles. The walk to the park is easy if you head up Disneyland drive and walk through the Grand California Hotel. There are signs telling walkers how to get to the parks from the hotel lobby, and it is common for people to take this route. We stayed once as a couple and once as a family with young kids. We went to visit the parks and did not spend much time in our room. The beds were fine, the pillows are kind of small, square shaped. We slept fine both visits. This is not a 4-Star hotel with fancy amenities, but if
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving us your review. We look forward to hearing from our guests and their thoughts concerning any changes that you suggest.  We are happy to hear that you will be continuing to stay with us.  See you again soon.

Summary: Needed new carperts. But otherwise comfortable. Had a pool which was good after being out all day. The breakfast was nice and useful. Good value for money being in the disney area, and as we were only in the room to sleep we felt it was comfortable enough for our needs.it is a way from disney to walk but we drove straight to disney from our previous location and then checked in after our day at disney and the second day we went to universal in the car so it was okay for what we wanted.
Manager Response: none

Summary: this hotel is perfect for a budget traveller . good breakfast , near to disneyland , many restaurants are in walking distance . If you want to walk to disneyland , walk through walnut street and enter the disney parking lot and take the free tram . Or walk little bit more towards the disney downtown and take the monorail near to rainforest cafe to disneyland .  If you have little kits , take a break from disneyland come back and rest in the hotel for 1-2 hours and head back again fresh .
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here in February 2014 with my boyfriend so I know I'm a little late writing.. but this hotel was a great stay for us. When we first arrived the front desk guy seemed like he didn't really want to be there.. but hey it was late at night, I understand. The rest of our time was great - rooms were clean with a fridge and a nice bathroom, pool area was great.. although the hot tub was colder than the pool itself, breakfast was a perfect bite before heading out to the parks (which were only about a 10 minute walk.) For the price that we paid, this place was great - and I really enjoyed my stay. Would stay here again if going to Disneyland, Downtown Disney, or California Adventure.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  We try to make our guests feel like they are part of the family when staying with us.  We understand that traveling can be a little hectic and do all that we can to make things easier.  It was a pleasure having you stay with us and we look forward to your many returns.

Summary: We were unimpressed all the way around. Here are the facts:  Location: We chose this hotel to go to Disneyland. It is on the opposite side of the park than we usually stay and was a long walk. With a 7 year old, it took 30 minutes. You have to walk through all of Downtown Disney in order to get to the park entrance, which is too far to come back to hotel midday. There is a shuttle, but it's $3 apiece and we did not use it. You cannot see fireworks or the park at all from the hotel.  Cleanliness: This was the biggest issue. The room was pretty filthy, as was the rest of the hotel. The sheets were cleaned, but the carpet was grotesque and we found a mysterious button (??) in our bed. The shower was very nice, but the handle on the door was cracked, the remote was caked with grime,
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is your normal Quality Inn.  I had reserved a accessible room and the room was as expected with a very nice big bathroom.  The picture that they have on their website was exactly how the room was.  I do like that Quality Inn offers free wifi, free parking and a hot breakfast.  The rooms also come with a refrigerator which is great for medications and drinks.  What I did not like about this stay.  My accessible room was not close to a handicap parking space and having arrived  there very late did not like that the parking at the back of the hotel is surrounded by all the apartment buildings and their parking.  I did not feel safe at all although nothing happened.  The hotel employees were all friendly.  I did not get up in time to have the breakfast but am sure it was the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice, clean motel very close to disneyland. We arrived early morning and were allowed to park our car there before checking in in the afternoon. Staff are very friendly. Cont breakfast included nothing fancy but exactly what we needed. Rooms are dated but clean and tidy. Would stay here again definately.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights last week. It was a good stay. If you go in with the motel expectations, then you won't be surprised with the hotels' look. The rooms are ok. Breakfast is good. Front desk is very helpful. But the best thing is the location. It is a 15 minute walk to the main Disneyland and California Adventure entrance and downtown Disney via the Grand California Hotel lobby . Ask the front office for directions. There's an even shorter walk to California Adventure park only via Grand California Hotel but that's only for the Grand California guests up till 11AM. So, make sure to not follow that.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We walked 20 minutes to Disneyland. One day, we booked a car for LA City sightseeing and were waiting outside the hotel. The car was late and were worried. The director came and helped us to contact the rental company. Thank you for this.  The breakfast was quite OK for both adults and kids. Served warm too and had varieties. Good location, warm hospitality and reasonable budget hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed two nights here and had a nice stay. It's very close to Disneyland and downtown Disney which are only about a 15 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel is showing signs of wear and tear like some of the carpets and furniture in the rooms. They do have a pretty nice breakfast layout and the Wi-Fi worked very well. Overall not bad. We would stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed for 3 days over weekend in April, in 2 twin bed suite on second floor towards rear of comples with family including 2 preschoolers. Life-long experience road tripping/travelling abroad and staying at motels/hotels during treks. The best motel experience thus far.  Selected this place over more expensive and higher rated hotels for the value: * across the street from California Adventure, 15 min walk to gates, with free parking for duration of stay * clean, safe, air-conditioned room to crash after spending entire day at Disney; balcony and chairs to enjoy early morning when we had breakfast in room (Euro-pillows are small but sufficient) * complimentary breakfast which included both warm (DIY waffles; coffee/tea/hot chocolate, toast, sausage, hardboiled eggs etc) and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Pay a little extra and stay someplace nicer!
Summary: Although we were gone all day to the park, we would not want to stay here again.  I did not want to touch anything in the room...walls, light fixtures, floor,etc. My advise is to spend a little more for a nicer place. The only thing this hotel had going for it is location.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Good stay for the price. The property is an older hotel the area around the pool could use some updating and cleaning. The room was clean and nice it has been updated. For the price this is a great place. It was a close walk to the park about 10-15 min there are other avenues to take to get to the park. We had a great experience upon our arrival with the front desk clerk the staff is very nice. The breakfast is good will fill you up and get you energized for the park. Did not have an issue with parking but could see that it might be in season. I would stay here again and recommend it to others. One note the rooms are not sound proof had to get up and knock on the neighbors door just a warning if you are a loud talker someone can hear everything you are saying.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts.  We have been working on bringing more flowers into the pool area and also updating the tables and chairs.  There is a towel rack coming in soon to eliminated the need for the towel bin that we currently use.  We are always open to suggestions from our guests and would be happy to hear anything you have to say.  We look forward to talking to you on your next visit.

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in February for our 1 day trip to Disney before an international flight.  The staff were friendly and the room was modest, but clean. The hot tub was not working during our stay, but this was a minor inconvenience. Also, the coffee maker in our room needed a serious cleaning, and the coffee served in the lobby was never hot.   The included breakfast was nothing to write home about, but did have a waffle iron station which was nice.  The best thing about this hotel was the close proximity to the Disney Parks. It was about an 8 - 10 minute walk which was very convenient.   Overall this was a good, average budget hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your comments for others to read.  We read and share everything written with our staff so we can improve on what our guests need.  I wish you were a little more specific about our breakfast, we would like to include items that our guests would enjoy.  If you feel like discussing more with me feel free to call the hotel and I would be happy to talk to you.  Thank you again for your comments and we look forward to speaking again soon.

Summary: I normally stay a one of the Choice hotels when traveling on business. I checked into this dump late. Opened the first room and was invited into a work area. Extension cords stretched across the floor, paper and pen on the bed plus an unpleasant odor. Called the desk immediately and he switched me to a "suite". Nothing sweet about the suite. Dusty, dirty carpet, tooth picks on the floor, dirty coffee pot, noisy air conditioner and poor shower.
Manager Response: Dear Sir, I am sorry about the condition of your room.  Let me assure you that this is not our quality of service that we strive for.  I will find out immediately why you were able to check into a dirty room.  I hope you will give us another chance to show you that we are a clean and comfortable hotel.

Summary: Me and my boyfriend stay here everytime we go to Disneyland. It's relatively inexpensive for being so close to the park. Check in is hassle free and the rooms are clean. There is free parking, which  is great considering parking at other hotels/disneyland is over $20 a day. There's a continental breakfast of coffee, sausage,eggs, and cold donuts, The coffee is okay but i would skip everything else.There's a Denny's adjacent to the hotel that we always go to for a cheap alternative to park food. I plan on staying here again.
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that you do not take advantage of our morning breakfast.  If there is something that you would like to see us offer that we currently do not please let us know.  We try to provide something for everyone but need our guests help in making these decisions.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us.  We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: Hotel is a good inexpensive option for Disney. It is just under a mike walk from the hotel to the main gate so approximately 20-25 minute walk. The walk is all along well lit sidewalks and safe. The hotel is older but very clean. Room was very large and hotel had a nice pool and courtyard area. They also have a nice free breakfast with pre-made egg patties and sausage, a waffle station and other basic breakfast items. The breakfast area was a little tight but there were plenty of tables available in the outside courtyard. Overall very convenient. If you stay here and plan to walk to disneyland take a right out of the hotel and a left at the first light. That will take you past the Disney grand Californian hotel. Enter the hotel lobby and go to the left following the signs to the
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing all of the wonderful information with our guests.  I would like to clarify your directions, when going through the Grand Californian hotel to enter the Disney parks you head towards Downtown Disney and not the Convention Center.  We are close to the Convention Center but that is located outside of the Disney Parks area.  If anyone is ever confused by the directions just ask the front desk and we are always happy to point you in the right direction. Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we can't wait for your return.

Summary: My wife chose this hotel because of its location, across the street from Disneyland. Little did we know the wonderful surprises we had in store for us. Here are a couple: A half eaten sandwich stuffed inside the pull out bed, multiple holes and cigarette burns in the blankets, and mattress springs that make you wish you were sleeping on the floor. Apparently this was all after there "renovation".
Manager Response: I apologize for not meeting your expectations during your recent stay with us.  Our front desk is open 24 hours.  If these problems were reported to us we would have been happy to find you another room that you would have been more comfortable.  We value you as a customer and would have done anything to make you happy.  Please come back and stay with us so we can show you that our service is exceptional.

Summary: Found this property through Trip Advisor while planning a 2-night getaway to Disneyland.  Scored a $72 a night rate by signing up for Choice Rewards.  I called to advise we would arrive late - check in was easy and the desk clerk had already done a walk of the parking lot and knew where to direct us to park (property was full and we were last guests to check in, so there was literally one parking spot remaining).  Bed was comfy but we could have each used an additional pillow since they use euro squares.  Having a fridge was convenient.  They might want to invest in better coffee packs - the non-decaf tastes like brown water not coffee.  We looked over the free breakfast but opted to get food inside Disneyland.  Quick walk to the parks.  They've done a decent job renovating an
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us.  I would like to assure you that if you arrive late we will still find you a parking spot.  Just come to the front desk and let us know, if we have to we will move our vehicle. We allow our guests who check out to stay parked in our parking lot if they are going to the park for the day.  Parking spaces tend to open up towards the end of the night because of this. We would love to be able to put different flooring in the rooms and take out the carpet.  However at this time Choice does not allow it.  We are working on the carpets at this time and will be changing it completely soon.   I hope this information helps you for any future stays you have with us.

Summary: Brought my grandkids to Disneyland and from the reviews I read, thought this would be a good place to stay. The only good thing about it was that it was walking distance to Disneyland, had a refrigerator and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The first night we got there the T.V. didn't work. They did send someone to fix it. Very thin floors. We could hear the people upstairs walking and talking well into the night all three days of our stay. The beds were ok but the pull out couch was awful! The room was old, smelled and the carpet needed to be replaced. The breakfast was ok if you like cold eggs. I well not stay here again.
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your stay with us.  We have recently been cleaning the carpets and have scheduled extra cleaning to the schedule.  We thank you for staying with us and hope that you reconsider staying with us again.

Summary: We stayed at the hotel for a week to visit Disney and the local area.  The location was good, it took 15 mins to walk to Disney. The room was good and the bed comfortable. The breakfast was good and as well as continental options it included sausage and egg.  We did not use the pool.   Our only issue was that the room was not cleaned properly with dust on the headboard and bedside table. Also cups were not replaced and the coffee machine was left dirty for a few days. We did complain and the cleaning improved.  So over all a good value option near to Disney, but perhaps need to ensure the staff are always cleaning the rooms correctly, they should be checked more frequently by a supervisor.
Manager Response: It is a priority to have clean rooms and yours not being properly inspected is something that I will discuss with the supervisor this morning.  I realize that we have new housekeepers but it is expected that they be properly trained before being allowed to be on their own.  This issue will be taken care of immediately.  Thank you for bringing this to my attention.

Summary: This was a great location to visit Disneyland.  We enjoyed our stay.  Staff was friendly and helpful and our room was always cleaned and well stocked for the next day. We stayed for 10 nights and would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your comments.  I'm happy that you enjoyed your extended stay with us.  You gave us a little low rating in the service department but made a nice comment.  I hope that all of our staff was helpful and courteous.  Please contact me if there was anything that was not done or anything that we can improve on. Thank you for staying with us and we hope to make your next trip to Anaheim even better that the last.

Summary Heading: Perfect spot for us to stay while visiting Disneyland!
Summary: We stayed five nights here.  The evening staff was great, especially Patricia!  We had requested a first floor due to an injury, and when we arrived the only 2 queens were upstairs.  We did that for three nights, and it was taking its toll on the injury.  Patricia accommodated our needs and we were able to spend our last two nights on the first floor.  The location was about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland for our family of four.  We thought we would come back for lunch, but it was easier to stay there.  Mimi's Cafe is around the corner....highly recommended!
Manager Response: I think you stayed with the Quality in and Suites Anaheim at the Resort and not with us.  I am sure Patricia will be pleased to know that she was appreciated for her efforts when I forward this comment to her.  Thank you for staying with Choice Hotels.

Summary Heading: Nice, Comfortable Stay - Very Good All the Way Around
Summary: We stayed here for one night on a recent vacation to So. Cal.  We were driving up from Carlsbad and going straight to Disneyland.  Even though we couldn't check in early, they did let us park the car there for free.  We were able to check in after Disneyland closed with no problems.  The hotel is within walking distance to Disneyland.  The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean.  Breakfast was good -- waffles, oatmeal, cereal, yogurt, etc.  Price was better than other nearby hotels.
Manager Response: I am happy to hear that you enjoyed our breakfast.  We get a lot of guest feedback about what we serve. We try to provide something for everyone.  Thank you for staying with us and hope to see you again soon.

Summary: I was a looking for a hotel for my last minute business meeting and quick visit to Disneyland. I'm an annual pass holder so while in town, I always try to spend a few hours in the parks. I booked online. The check in process at the hotel was a breeze. And I received an awesome little goodie bag for being a Choice Hotels member! The hotel parking lot is the worst and there isn't much room for someone with an SUV, especially if you get back to your room late. The outside of the hotel is a little dated, but the inside is awesome. My room was big, clean and setup nicely. I slept REALLY well. New TVs with great channel selection. The property has a playground, so I know it's got to be perfect for families. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: I am happy to hear that you stumbled upon us.  I hope that you will continue to stay with us when in the area.

Summary Heading: They hit the mark, first round!
Summary: After taking a suggestion from friends about hotels in the area we were upset. We didn't have the experiences they all did. So I went on a hunt of my own, and found this hidden gem. Just a few blocks from Disneyland was exactly what we wanted. The room was clean, comfortable and the staff was more than delightful. Having a hot breakfast before another day out was a bonus. The dining area was a bit crowded but still comfortable and bubbling with conversations about Disney. The price was great and we definitely recommend it to anyone with a family on a budget, looking for a clean place with all the amenities :) Can't wait for our next trip!
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review.  I'm sure that it will help some people with making future reservations.  Hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Dated on the Outside, Remodeled on the Inside - Service with a SMILE
Summary: We were looking for a room close enough to the parks but not something that was going to kill the wallet and nickel and dime you. This resort is on the backside of Disney's California Adventure,  close enough to walk from to the Grand California and Downtown Disney.  Comfortable beds, hot breakfast in the morning, and  FREE nightly parking!!!!!  The only few negative things I have to say about this property is no elevator, and the stairs are not covered.  During our visit it rained 1.5 days which made the stairs extremely slippery.  House keeping was also on top of their game; placing bottled drinks in the fridge after we left them out.  They went above and beyond during out stay!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about our housekeeping staff. They try to make sure that everything is the way that they would want it. I will share your comments with our staff. Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: If you are visiting Disneyland this is only a 8-10 minute walk away.  An older updated motel with nice beds, flat screen TV, a decent breakfast, clean and well run.  Ask for a room towards the back, away from the road and it will even be quiet.  We booked ours on getaroom for $56 a night for two doubles! We stayed four nights and had a great time.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review on our hotel.  It was excellent advice for people who are not used to the city noise from traffic.  We always try to spot the guests from areas that are not accustomed to our everyday sounds. Thank you again for the excellent advice. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: It was the NAMM convention last weekend so most hotels were booked solid or just insanely priced.   The front desk clerk was nice and fast at check in.  I asked for the second floor and got it. The location is great along with free breakfast in the morning.  There were a few details that need work.  The room could have been vacuumed better.  Second too much furniture in a small room.  It made room 231 feel too cramped.  Third the towels.  Horrible towels.    I liked the different plants in the inside courtyard but I felt the kids playground area is a bit out of place.  I think if they worked on courtyard and fixed up some minor details it would be worth going back but for now I probably wouldn't.
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that you were not happy with your accommodations during your stay.  We have discussed removing the playground area to some extent but guest opinions are mixed.  We have been working on deep cleaning and focusing on any minor repairs.  Your opinion matters to us and we would love to hear any suggestions that you may have.  If you are from out of the area or do not expect to travel anytime soon you can contact me at the front desk.  Again I would love to talk about how we can improve the property for yourself and future guests.

Summary Heading: Great Location - get what you pay for
Summary: Honestly, this hotel for the price, can't be beaten. Walking distance from Disneyland. Breakfast was average but for the price you can expect much. This place is value for money, rooms are big and comfortable. Has a microwave, Denny's across the road. When you are staying here it's for Disneyland not to spend time in your room, it's a bed to sleep in and it was fine, if stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your opinion with us.  We would like to make your stay better than average and would like to hear any suggestions you may have.  I hope you will stop by the front desk during your next stay to discuss how we can improve.

Summary Heading: Incredible value a stone's throw from Disneyland
Summary: Just finishing up a 4 night stay.  This hotel is an incredible value very close to Disneyland.  Sure, the rooms aren't perfect, as some other reviewers have pointed out - the bathroom needs some TLC. But it's clean, the breakfast is great, the pool and common areas are very clean. The breakfast is hot and wonderful, with lots of outdoor overflow seating. The poolside patio furniture is in better shape then the $300 a night Hilton I just stayed at.  There's even a (basic) kids playground.  There's a Denny's next door too, for when you can't stomach the food prices at Disneyland any more!  To get here fast from Disneyland: Cut through the grand califonian hotel (and see how the other half lives).  Service was great, and they upgraded us for free to a room with 2 Queens.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review.  Its nice to know that our patio furniture ranks higher than the higher end hotels in the area.  It just goes to show you how much we do to make our guess comfortable.

Summary Heading: Nothing Great, Just an Adequate Hotel
Summary: Just an average hotel at best.  The hotel is not anything special other than its close proximity to Disneyland which is just across the street.  Our room was clean, the staff really helpful and friendly which are the strong points of this hotel.  Other than that, the property is older and in need of some updating but the grounds, pool and the playground in the middle courtyard was kept in good order.  This hotel was just good enough and was cheap enough to be ok.  Offers good value if you can get it at a low price.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about the Quality Inn & Suites Anaheim at the Park.  I am happy to see that you enjoyed your stay here.  We look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary: This a nice property near Disneyland on Katella.  The staff was polite on check-in and the rooms were nice. The hotel is an older motor court style from the 60's and 70's with outdoor corridors. There is some sound bleed from the central located pool outside, but nothing that is disturbing.   Quick 5-10 minute walk to Downtown Disney and the parks, cheap rates, clean rooms, nice staff make for a great location and stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words about your stay with us.  We appreciate all responses that our guests  make.  We look forward to your return.

Summary: This facility is very old and is in desperate need of a renovation.  It was not very clean.  The traffic on Katella Avenue is quite noisy.  They do have a full breakfast and the staff was very pleasant.  We would not stay here again
Manager Response: I apologize for the property not meeting your standards. I can assure you that our rooms are cleaned daily. I will talk to the housekeeping staff and review our cleaning procedures immediately. Again I am sorry that your stay was not a pleasant one.

Summary: The hotel is very convenient for visitors willing to walk to Disneyland and California Adventure.  The room (#227) was spacious, the beds were very comfortable, the TV was nice, the channel selection was good, and the bedding, towels, and cleanliness were excellent.  The balcony would have been used more often if the plastic seats were not so dirty.  The breakfast was always the same, and after a few days, we were rather tired of it, but it was hot, well stocked, and maintained.  The staff was fantastic.  The first night there, the electricity went out in the bathroom.  I reported it and it was taken care of by the time we returned to our room that afternoon.  The fridge and microwave were perfect for us as we stayed at the hotel for 5 days.  The pool was clean and deep which
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts with us. We have discussed our breakfast menu and thought about changing the items every other day. When we brought this up with our guests they had mixed feelings about this.  Most people want to have the waffles everyday while others want to make sure we still have the sausage and eggs everyday.  We appreciate our guest feedback and would love to hear any suggestions that you may have.  I look forward to hearing from you.

Summary Heading: Back for the second time; still a great value
Summary: I had business in the Disneyland area and was back at this hotel in November 2013, over a year after I stayed here last time (June 2012). There are sooo many hotels next to Disneyland and I decided to stay here again because it was a good value and the convenient location was also a factor. I do have a limited travel budget so the Disneyland Hotel was not an option. I want to clarify what I said before in my previous review last year about the hotel looking drab: I don't think the hotel is run down. It's just an older building (stucco, cinder block stairs, and iron railings reminiscent of the 1970s hotel or motel experience, like many of the older hotels immediately surrounding the Disney property). If you are visiting Disneyland or the Anaheim Convention Center, this hotel is
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for staying with us again for your trip to Anaheim.  We are working on updating the hotel and hope that you will be able to stay with us in the future to see all of our improvements.  Thank you again for your review.

Summary: Stayed her a few days and enjoyed the breakfast; small room though and crowded.  The room was big enough and included microwave and fridge; carpets could've been cleaner.  Overall good choice for the period of time we stayed.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review.  I hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Good Room, Great Distance to Disney
Summary: We stayed 3 nights, it was excellent walking distance to Downtown Disney and the Disneyland Parks.  It was great, we were able to see the Fireworks from Disneyland.  Staff was very friendly, continental breakfast was filling.  My only complaint would be that the carpet needs an overhaul in the room we stayed in, and it would be nice if the bathroom had a fan.
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review.  I read each one and take all suggestions into consideration when making decisions for the hotel.  I have already notified staff to double the amount of carpets cleaned each day.  I will discuss options for the fan in the bathroom with our staff.  Thank you again for your feedback.

Summary Heading: Nice place and in vicinity of the Disneyland
