Summary: I stayed here for 2 nights. Room was neat and clean and tidy. Staff was helpful and even was given late checkout on request.  I was initially worried about the cleanliness and surrounding but was very much relaxed when had the first look.   It was also very convenient. I had purchased pass for Anaheim Resort Transit to commute instead of driving myself. The bus stop was next to hotel within 50 yards. Making it convenient in commuting to and fro.  It was a wonderful trip and stay.
Manager Response: I am happy to hear that you had a pleasant stay with us.  I look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: Like other reviewers have noted this is good value lodging. There are many hotels on this strip and the price is good. Nothing too exciting about the room decor. Positives: Free breakfast better than most higher end hotels. They had the breakfast bar very well stocked. Sausage patties, croissants, breads, make your own fresh waffles (wonderful), yogurt, coffee, etc. The swimming pool and spa where nice too. The room came equipped with a microwave and mini fridge. Perfect for keeping our left overs. Denny's is next door and so are shopping areas. We walked the first day back and forth to Disneyland. 2nd day we took the bus back. It is next door to disneyland.... BUT disneyland is huge. Took at least 20 minutes to the disneyland entrance.  I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your review.  I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: This hotel was a very good rate. We stayed here mid-september on a stop over trip to San Fran. The hotelroom had plenty of space for our family of 3 BUT it did smell really really musty.  The shower curtain was a bit worn. The water pressure was great!  The breakfast provided was very good but the seating area was so incredibly small. The woman at the front desk was a wonderful help with out Disneyland visit.  She gave us some tips and helped us order our tickets.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review.  I apologize for any musty smell that you experienced during your stay.  We will schedule extra daily carpet cleaning. I hope you do not let this prevent you from staying with us in the future.

Summary: My husband and I stayed here during our family trip to Disneyland at the end of Sep. They had a great rate, and a good location to Disney.     When we first pulled up the color scheme was a real turn off, they really need to do something better with the colors. However, the staff was excellent and super helpful. The room was comfortable and clean. And the pool area is surrounded by absolutely beautiful flowers.     Most mornings we were up and going earlier than the other guests (thanks to my little dude that's a morning person), so the breakfast area was fine. On our check out day it was more croweded inside, so we enjoyed the nice weather outside at the picnic tables.       They do have a kids play set with a slide, and it would be great if they could put beach sand in it. The
Manager Response: Thank you for the informative review you sent.  I will share your feedback with the owner and see what we can do about the color of the building.  I agree with you 100% but unfortunately we seem to be the only two people who do not like it.  I will continue to get guest feedback and hope for the best.  Your other comment regarding the play area came at an excellent time.  We are discussing if we should keep that area as a playground or take it out completely.  Again, I will share your views with our employees and take your view into consideration.  Thank you for your help in making our hotel all that it can be.

Summary: Stayed here 4 nights during our visit to Disney.found the hotel very well cared for and clean.staff all very friendly and helpful.as good a Choice hotel breakfast as you are ever going to get! Swimming pool area very clean and well maintained and very nice outdoor seating area.real bonus of only being 15 minutes walk to Disney.cannot recommend enough for the money.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  I'm sure the information you provided will help us to see more guests.  Thank you for staying with us.  We look forward to your future return.

Summary: You have your own balcony if you stay in one of the rooms on the top floor. The room was clean. My only complain was that the Wi Fi was terrible! Sometimes it doesn't work. If Wi-Fi is not an issue this hotel is too bad.
Manager Response: I am sorry that the internet was not working well during your stay.  We had an incident that took out one of our routers.  We have had it replaced since and is back to working order.  The front desk does have additional passwords for the hotspots we use as back up.

Summary: My family and I stayed for 3 weeks and in all that time, we had no complaints.  The staff behind the front desk were wonderful and friendly.  Very helpful when booking tours and with suggestions on what to see.  The hotel was close to Disneyland, a lovely 10/15 minute walk to that magical place.  The rooms were always clean and tidy, thankyou to the house keepers who did a fantastic job.  It was great to wake up to breakfast every morning.  The food was delicious.  Will stay there again and will recommend the hotel to others.  Thank you for a great stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to express your pleasure with our service.  We understand that most people only think to share their experience when there was a negative situation.  It is especially appreciated when you take that extra time to just say thank you.  From all of us here I would like to say "Your welcome".

Summary: There are so many good things about this hotel. The location is very convenient, within walking distance from Disney . With our 8 and 5 year old children it was a longer walk, so after doing it once we opted to buy day passes for the ART shuttle and it worked out great. The stop is right outside the hotel and it's a quick drive to and from the park. The cost for a day pass is $5 for adults and $2 for children. (Note though that you cannot buy day passes at this hotel. You either need to walk one block to Annabella Hotel or get them at Disney.) The staff were friendly, helpful and attentive. Breakfast was very good with many good choices, including hot waffles, eggs, sausage, cereals, fruit and yogurt, just to name a few. You can save time and money by eating in the hotel before
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest review.  I have viewed your photos and will immediately schedule cleaning of all furniture.  I realize that the rooms are outdated and I will discuss our choices with the owner and see if we can replace items sooner than planned.  We have already been looking at carpet samples and will proceed now that the summer season is over.  I apologize if you did not feel comfortable during your stay but assure you that all matters will be addressed.  I look forward to seeing you again.

Summary Heading: Great deal for families visiting Disney Resort
Summary: If you want an affordable and decent stay near the Disney Resort, look no further; this is the destination to check out. The rooms are clean, and arranged just with the sort of things to keep you organized. The majority of the day is spent elsewhere anyways. We spent three nights at the hotel, and even with our ears pressed to the walls, had trouble to hear some noise from other rooms. The staff did it for us from check-in to check-out, with recommendations and being helpful on any item we requested (i.e. cork screw, extra utensils, glasses and cups, extra bathroom items etc.). The breakfast was plenty enough to keep us going, and frankly, they don't serve any better at Danny's for $10. The benefit here is it's included, so take advantage of it!  The outside amenities are a pool
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review.  I know I speak for our entire staff when I say that it is always a pleasure to help in any way we can when a guest needs that extra help.  We understand that most people are not familiar with the area when visiting and sometimes we can make suggestions that make the difference (mostly about how to avoid our traffic).  Thank you again and we hope to see you again.

Summary: A well kept property, it is a bit smaller than most hotels but I was very satisfied with the overall stay. Friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms and a short walk to Downtown Disney or the Garden Walk of Anaheim.  I have stayed at this location several times and will continue to do so.
Manager Response: I appreciate your kind words regarding our staff. I know that each one of them will make that extra effort to help in any way that they can.  Thank you for staying with us and hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Good experience- One problem NO SHUTTLE TO DISNEYLAND
Summary: Within walking distance to disneyland - The rooms are not very big but we also didnt go to spend time in our rooms- The staff was AWESOME- they gave us a room facing the fireworks! The trees and plants make the experience relaxing- Breakfast includes waffles, danishes, cereal, yogurt, orange juice and coffee- OVERALL Great place to stay-
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing information about your recent stay with us.  I am always pleased to hear that our staff helped to make your stay memorable.  I just wanted to let you know that there is a shuttle provided by ART for the fee of $3.00 each way to the Disney parks.  That will pick you up right next door at the Denny's. I am sorry you were not informed of this during your stay, I hope that this will be of some help the next time you come.

Summary: 1st off we booked this room on choicehotels.com which was easy. Price was o.k. for the location but when you see other motels that look a lot nicer you start to question the price. $215 total, with being a choicehotels.com member and having AAA discount.  We stayed here for 2 nights on a 4 night trip to Disneyland. We stayed at Rodeway Inn in Artesia for the 1st 2 night and then moved here. The reason for the move was we added on the 1st 2 night at the last minute and the prices here were too high.  The staff was friendly and fast.  Room #132! After staying at Rodeway, walking in to this room was disappointing. 1st off it was very stuffy and smelled because they cleaned the carpet but they do not open the windows or turn on the air to vent it out, so it drys with a stench. The
Manager Response: I apologize for not meeting your expectations during your recent visit with us.  Please be assured that we read every comment both good and bad and use this information to make changes or upgrades to the hotel. Thank you for sharing your experience and we hope that you will stay with us again in the future.

Summary: We stayed 6 nights recently  and had a lovely stay. Rooms could probably be updated but were fine. Breakfast was very good and we were up early each day so avoided the crowds after 7.30am. Pool area very pleasant and staff friendly and helpful. Next to a Denny's which was useful if you want a break from the parks. 15 minute walk to Downtown Disney and a further 5 minutes to both parks. Nice to have free Wi-Fi and free parking. Would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving a response.  I appreciate the information you provided to encourage possible guests. We look forward to your future visits.

Summary: I have paid a lot less for nicer rooms. We wanted a suite because we brought our granddaughter to Disneyland. What we got was a room with two double beds and a little side room with a dirty sofa and a beat-up coffee table. The room was stifling hot when we got in it at 10:00 the first night--air con was off. The furniture is worn out; the carpet is dirty; the staff is friendly, and it is close to the park.
Manager Response: I am sorry that our hotel did not meet your expectations during your latest stay.  We have been cleaning carpets everyday and are considering changing the sofa to an additional bed for the extra room suite.  I hope you will continue to stay with Choice Hotels in the future and particularly with us. We would love to have you.

Summary: Stayed here for family trip to Disney in July.  Staff was friendly and helpful.   It is a 15-20 minute walk to the park gate with no shuttle service option.  The building is older and has been partly updated, like washrooms and outdoor paint and AC unit.  Our room was technically a suite, but in reality it was a 2 queen room with an additional tiny room that had a sofa bed & small table in it.  And, the sofa bed mattress was so uncomfortable for my 8 yr. old that she slept on it like a reg. sofa (ie, closed).  Plus the only way to open the sofabed was to  put the table up on its end in the corner!  When we arrived the room smelled unpleasant with a strong musty odor.  The carpets may have been shampooed but had no ventilation to air dry very well--I don't know.  We turned up the
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and suggestions.  We read all reviews and appreciate any feedback we receive.  Due to your comments regarding our sofa sleeper we have been discussing our options.  We are talking to current guests who are staying in this room to find out if taking out the sofa and replacing it with a single or double bed would be more accommodating. We believe that most of our guests are not using this extra room as a place to sit but instead as an extra bed.  We would love to hear any ideas that you have. We hope to hear from you soon.

Summary Heading: GREAT LOCATION!  FREE PARKING!  DECENT ROOMS!
Summary: We had a nice stay at this hotel.  The room we stayed in was somewhat updated and you could tell that management has been making a real good effort on giving you that upgraded feel without breaking their wallet.  Breakfast was very good, however, the front lobby/dining area is very small and cramped.  People are stepping over each other trying to get their plates filled.  Since, the breakfast is included (and pretty good), I don't think anyone would really complain about this.  I will definitely stay here again.  The staff was very helpful and Disneyland is about a 2 big-block walk.  We paid $99/night for a 2-bed room.  I don't know that I would pay more than that for this hotel though.
Manager Response: I am happy to hear that you enjoyed our breakfast.  We are having another two tables delivered that will seat 7. We plan on putting those outside. I hope that you will plan on staying with us soon and be able to enjoy the added seating.

Summary: Free WI FI, Free breakfast, and very quiet at night.  My room was not filthy and the beds were very comfortable.  The walk to disneyland was o.k.  It is very sad that they have shut off access thru the California Hotel, because they dont want us average folk gracing their hotel, so it is another 10/15 minute walk.  The price here is reasonable, the hot tub bubbles werent working so that was a little disappointing, I was told they would fix it, but never  checked to see if they did. I honsetly dont think you would be disappointed at all if you stayed here.  I will again if and when we make it back to disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review for potential guests.  We appreciate every one that comes in. Without having comments, concerns or suggestions we would not be able to make appropriate changes. Thank you again for taking the time.

Summary: The room was dirty. The carpet was absolutely filthy. My son took his shoes off and his feet were black within 5 minutes. I asked the front desk to please clean the carpets. Was told at first they couldn't without access to the room for a 24 hour drying period but they relented and cleaned them and put a carpet dryer on them. Breakfast area is the lobby. They just pull tables out and it's very crowded. Food was usually gone. Tables were never cleaned. The walls seem paper thin as you can hear everyone walk outside your door. The window in the bathroom is odd. You can open it to vent the steam from hot showers but the walkway is right there so anyone walking on the balcony gets a free peep show. I could easily tolerate all of this if they had a shuttle leaving say once an hour to
Manager Response: I am sorry that you did not enjoy your trip.  I realize the breakfast area is small and we have been adding tables outside for more seating.  The days when everyone seems to come down at the same time we also open up the pool area early so people can sit at those tables.  I will continue to find more options for the people who are left without a place to sit and who do not want to eat in their rooms. Our hotel is an older building and only a few of the rooms have fans in the restrooms.  I don't know what we can do with regard to the windows and lack of ventilation but I will discuss this with my staff and see if there is a solution. I do apologize for your trip not being all that it could have been.

Summary Heading: Second time was defintely not a charm
Summary: I was a little disenchanted the second time around, with this hotel.  First of all, when we booked, we called and requested a specific room and were told it would be available for us.  When we got there, it was a different story, and trust me, all rooms are not created equal here.  The first room we stayed in was spacious and nice, and what was better, it was a free stay for us with Choice Privelages bonus points.  This time, as paying customers, we got a much smaller room, it looked dirtier, and the staff didn't have a reason for the room we requested being unavailable.  They were also resurfacing the sidewalks during our visit, which meant in order to get to our car, we had to walk through the sand playground.  Imagine sand in the shoes all day!  During breakfast in the
Manager Response: I apologize for not providing the quality service that we are known for.  I can only say that we always honor the room type when at all possible. When we do have to change the type we will only upgrade.  I do not know what the issue was with your specific reservation but I do apologize if you were not given exactly what you had requested.  I cannot think of words to express my feelings when thinking about the child who threw up during breakfast.  I do hope that everyone concerned in the incident was ok.  We follow hotel policy with regard to the cleaning of situations like this and want to assure you that as soon as our staff was made aware of the situation it was sanitized.  I realize that this made your breakfast unpleasant and I apologize for situations where we have no control. I hope you are able to stay with us again in the future to appreciate our exceptional service.

Summary Heading: Great location - Great Service - Very decent rooms
Summary: Booked with Choice Privileges points and stayed here for 4 nights. Even if I paid for this , just the free parking, free breakfast and great location covers it all. The reception/front of house people are great, we met about 3 different ones and all were great in terms of helping out with what we needed and were willing to have a chat. Had a real family feel to it.  The room were good, a little stuffy but once we powered on the air con and open the windows it was ok.  The carpets could do with a bit of a clean but besides for that , everything was clean and there was plenty of space.  Walking distance from disneyland (about 15 min) and a bit of a walk to the shopping complex. A dennys and convenience were right next door which came in really handy.   Overall a great experience,
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  Carpets are being cleaned on a daily basis now.  Hope to see you soon.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel primarily due to its location to disney and family. The staff was very helpful and friendly. They even gave us directions for a short cut to Downtown Disney. Although the hotel is currently renovating its public areas the work did not affect our stay and the rooms were clean in spite of the work being done. I would not hesitate to stay with this property in the future.
Manager Response: I apologize for the inconvenience you were forced to deal with when we had our walkways repaved.  We are very busy throughout the year and we thought we would be able to have it completed before the weekend.  I live and learn, the work ran two days longer than it should have.  I am happy to hear that you were not too bothered by it. Again I apologize.

Summary: We were disappointed in this property. I've stayed at Quality Inns before, and this was the lowest quality (kind of a no-quality inn). The room was hot all the time -- and it wasn't even that hot outside. The AC didn't work; just blew air that wasn't even as cool as the outside air. We asked them to fix it, but didn't see any difference. Every time we came back to the room it had a distinct disinfectant odor. We had to leave doors and windows open for an hour to air out the room. We were on the first floor and the floor boards in the room above us squeaked loudly. The pillows were small (the size of couch throw pillows) and flat. Fortunately, we didn't spend a lot of time in the room. Unfortunately, the time we spent in the room was at night and none of us slept well. It is
Manager Response: I apologize for your room being so uncomfortable to you.  I will have our staff double check all of the air conditioners today to ensure that all are functioning properly.  I realize that the weather has been rising in temperature lately and will make sure all staff are checking and double checking before renting the rooms.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 2 days in April 2013 to visit DisneyLand. From the outside it looked like a very shabby place but the interior of the room was very nice. Decor of the room was very nice and they provided a flat screen with Cable TV. The room also had a fridge and Microwave and the Bathroom was also good. Its very near the Disney parks and that was the reason we chose this hotel. The disney Drive is around 10 minutes walk from the hotel and then further 10 minutes to the entrance of the parks. I had read on Trip Advisor that we can buy the tickets from the hotel reception but when we landed they were out of the tickets so i had to buy them online. But the hotel staff was nice enough to let us print the tickets. One negative point is that this hotel has no elevator so
Manager Response: I do apologize for the confusion with the Disneyland tickets.  We are currently in the process of creating our new website and plan to make the tickets available to print from there.  Until that is done we are allowing our guests to use our computer in the lobby to just purchase them from the Disney website.  Again, I am sorry if this caused you any inconvenience.  I hope to see you again soon.

Summary: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, so I can visit Disney park while in Anaheim for a business trip. I moved from Embassy Suites after I compleated business part of my trip to Quality Inn, with was located closer to the park and was little cheaper, than another hotel. When I saw the hotel from the outside, I was little shoked - what an ugly little thing in the heart of tourist attractions. But I really liked my short stay. The hotel had everything I need.  Service was good, breakfast was o'k for the price. One thing I really did not like - very old worned out carpet. Nasty!
Manager Response: My first impression was to laugh after reading your comment.  I had the same thoughts regarding the  color scheme of the hotel myself.  You are actually the only person who has brought this up besides myself.  I think most of our guests are people who have been coming back to us for years and know that we offer such great service that they do not mind.  Whatever the reason, we are pleased to see many of our guests come back time and again.  We hope that you will be one of them.

Summary: We really enjoyed our time at the quality inn and suites anaheim at the park hotel.  We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights.  We have an 18 month old daughter.  They were able to give us a crib at no additional charge.  The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  They offer a great breakfast, and you can buy tickets for Disneyland at the hotel.  The pool and hot tub are great as well.  It is a hotel where your room opens to the outside which at first I was a little hesitant about, but the hotel is maintained very well.  It has updates to the rooms and it actually feels very cozy.  The only thing that was odd was that our bathroom was huge, and did not have a tub.  At first I thought it was a handicap bathroom, but I'm not sure.  It was just a big open shower area with a
Manager Response: I am pleased that you enjoyed staying with us. I am sorry that you were assigned our wheelchair accessible room. All of our rooms have both shower and bath except the one you were in.  Again I do apologize for the inconvenience.  Thank you for staying with us, hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: A good alternative to Disneyland hotels
Summary: Normally I would rate this hotel average but considering it is right next to Disneyland I think it is very good for the price. I stayed here for 5 nights to attend a trade show at the nearby Anaheim convention center. The big plus to this hotel is its proximity to Disneyland. Many people find the Disney property intimidating. Actually, from this hotel you can literally walk to Downtown Disney and get access to both Disneyland and CA Adventure. Many Europeans were staying at this hotel so they obviously know a good bargain. The hotel was clean overall but the property appears a bit drab. Not run down, but just a little old. The rooms themselves were fine and for the price you can't beat it. If you are looking for bare bones accommodation and want to be close to Disneyland I would
Manager Response: I look forward to the kind of review that you have shared. Our guests concerns or suggestions are what we hope to gain from these comments. I wish you could have shared more of what you considered "drab" about the property.  We are one of the original hotels in the area and much smaller than most.  For this reason we are always making changes and improvements. Recently we added more outside table for everyone to use either for breakfast or to just relax.  We have had quite a few people say how much they enjoy all of the flowers and plants that we have added.  There are more plans for the coming months and I hope you will come back and let us know what you think.

Summary: We Had a very good time in at Disneyland last summer 2012.  We stayed at Quality Inn.  I did'nt expect that much because we are on a budjet but every thing that we need was there.  We rented 2 rooms, one with 2 double size bed and one with a doube size bed and a sofa bed.  There's a microwave, fridge, coffeemaker and tv in the airconditioned room.  It's a walking distance to Disney park. We can go back to the inn in the afternoon to rest when we were tired and go back to the park in the evening.  There are a lot of fast food chain near by and the inn got a contenetal breakfast in the morning.  It's decent you got a lot to choose from. Pancke, fruits, pastries etc.., but there was no cold cuts but for me and the kids it was ok.  I am looking forward another vacation at Disneyland
Manager Response: I am happy to hear that we offered everything that you required on your trip to Anaheim.  We have recently been adding items to our breakfast and I am confused when you said that we did not offer "cold cuts".  We always take suggestions into consideration and hope that you will come by the front desk during your next trip and discuss this with me.  Thank you for staying with us and I will look forward to speaking with you.

Summary: Yes, this hotel is old and nothing fancy but the other benefits outweigh those drawbacks.  We traveled with a 5 yr old and we walked to and from the Disney parks from this location.  Yes, tiring at the end of the day but doable.  Any hotel off the Disney property is going to be a walk. Free parking (some hotels charge extra, Disney is $25/day. The breakfast they had was great - eggs, sausage, waffles, cereal, yogurt, fruit, donuts etc.  After you pay $7 for a bag of Cheetos and a bottle of water in the park, you appreciate such things.  Staff was nice.  For the price, I think it would be hard to beat this hotel.
Manager Response: It is always nice to hear that we were able to help make our guests vacation a happy one.  We are always working on the property and changing things in small ways.  We hope to see you soon so you can tell us what you think.

Summary: My sis and I chose this place for our return to childhood because of its reviews and especially the manager's (Shannon) responses to them.  Anyone who takes the time to respond obviously cares about the property and guests.  And she and the owner do!  Our room was spacious, comfortable, clean and quiet with all ammenities.  The upscale breakfast provided scrambled eggs, sausage, cold cereal, fresh homemade waffles, croissants, mini cinnamon rolls, breads, fresh fruit, juices, coffee, tea and hot chocolate, and was restocked quickly by a friendly attendant.  The dining area was small so we timed our dining around the excited kids going to Disneyland.  There are also tables outside in the patio area.  All of the staff were friendly and helpful.  This is a relaxing place to stay
Manager Response: I cannot thank you enough for your high praises.  I am definitely sharing this review with all of our staff.  There are not words to say how much fun you were to have stay with us.  I can only hope that you will be returning to the area again soon.

Summary Heading: Very Outdated but enjoyed our stay!
Summary: This Motel is very very outdated! I felt the need to wear flip flops when walking on the floor so I wouldn't have to touch the dirty carpet. The walls were also very dirty. The beds were clean and comfy though. What made this hotel worth it was the great service and free breakfast. The staff was incredible and so fun to talk to. They addressed every concern I had and helped me navigate around Anaheim. The breakfast was also great! They have a shuttle that takes you to the Disneyland Resort. It is 5.00 per adult for the whole day and 2.00 per child for the whole day. Unfortunately this hotel does not sell tickets like the Best Western does next door so you have to walk a few blocks to the Annabelle hotel to buy them but it is still on the same route to the parks so you can just
Manager Response: I apologize for your feeling that the room was dirty. I will go through our housekeeping procedures and review our training for the staff immediately.  We have a carpet cleaning schedule that we try to hold to, however this has been an extremely busy few months.  I will make sure that we are more observant with scheduling extra cleaning.  Thank you for bringing this situation to my attention, guest feedback is extremely important for this very reason.  I hope you can come back soon and see the rooms freshly cleaned carpets!

Summary Heading: Don't judge a book by it's cover!
Summary: I was a little nervous by the outside looks of the motel, but when we got inside I was pleasantly surprised.  We got the two queen size room.  Our room was huge!  There was also a fold out couch that we could have slept up to another 1 or 2 people!  Fridge was in the room and a microwave.  The bathroom was newly remodeled and looked freshly painted.  I think they only thing they could have done to improve the room was to change out the tile which was dirty and grungy, but  other than that, our 3 night visit went very well.  We could see the DL Fireworks from our window and we were right there close to the park.  We could have walked to Downtown Disney if we chose, but since we have season passes, we park for free.  The Mickey and Friends lot was right down the street.  I was
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words.  We do try to pay attention to detail in the rooms and so should every Choice hotel.  I am happy to hear that you will continue to stay with the Choice brand in the future. Thank you again.

Summary: We stayed here for three nights while visiting Disneyland. We had two rooms, one standard (for the in-laws) and one suite. We booked the suite in order to have a separate sleeping room for the kids. The extra room, however, was very small (just enough room to unfold the bed) and couldn't be used for much more than sleeping (it had no TV). Strangely, the extra room also lacked any heat (it only had a cooling unit). We were in Anaheim during a cold spell in January so this was problematic but didn't ruin our stay.  The standard room seemed a bit more updated than the suite but, aside from some peeling paint, both rooms were clean and comfortable. The hot breakfast was perfect (selection included belgian waffles, eggs, sausages, toast, pastries, cold cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit)
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts on your recent stay with us.  I am checking into the issue you had with no heat in the suites extra room.  I am also having the bathrooms repainted as we speak.  I will speak to our staff again about reporting any issues about the rooms to me.  Thank you for bringing these issues to my attention. I assure you that they will be fixed by your next visit.

Summary: The Quality Inn at Anaheim has it all:  - the rooms are reasonably priced (especially with a AAA discount)  - decently furnished (including flat screen TVs) - they offer a decent breakfast bar (make your own waffles, fresh fruit,   pastries…much more than packaged Danishes) - with in walking distance to the park and diners - great WIFI connection - friendly staff  Hands down, this is my favorite place to stay when visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your wonderful review.  We look forward to having you stay again soon.

Summary: I stayed here in December of 2012 for three days and four nights. It was easily within walking distance to Downtown Disney (take S. DIsneyland Dr. and cut through Grand Californian). It had a hot breakfast consisting of waffles, eggs, sausage along with cold cereal, fruit, yogurt, toast, mini muffins, machine OJ and apple juice and oatmeal. The motel is oriented like a U with the pool area in the middle. The room itself was very neat and presentable. The carpets were clean and taken care of. The bed and bedding were also neat and clean. The bathroom was very large and consisted of the sink, toilet and shower. It had a flat screen TV and a surprising number of channels. As we were leaving they were in the process of upgrading their TV service to all HD. The bed was comfortable
Manager Response: I have good news!  Our wi fi is up and running.  We have just finished with our largest convention of the year and everyone only had good things to say about it.  They did actually mention that last year was "spotty", but that this year was "great".  We are so happy to finally be able to provide everyone with this service and hope that you will stop in and try it.

Summary Heading: Don't judge a book by its cover
Summary: Don't let the outside fool you. The rooms are clean and well kept. They have obviously been updated.  Despite the obviously old building, the rooms are up-to-date.  Best of all, the staff was extremely nice and very helpful. Honestly, we had better service here than at Disneyland!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to comment on our hotel.  It is nice to know that we helped to make your stay enjoyable.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, comfortable beds, vet friendly staff
Summary: My family and I just stayed 3 nights here and overall our stay was excellent.   Room: our room was always clean and never saw any unexplained stains. However the carpets either need a good shampoo or need to be changed. The window in the bathroom is original and doesn't open/close very well. The beds are very very comfortable, no issues with sleep. People complained of thin walls, we never heard our neighbors. Fridge and microwave in room were perfect.   Breakfast: was average. The sausage and eggs are the microwave type, the waffles were make your own and good, good choice of cereal, pastries, and beverages.   Grounds: the hotel grounds were cleaned and well groomed. The pool was a little chilly, but it was Novemeber, the playground had sand in it so we kept our kids out of it
Manager Response: Thank you for noticing all of the hard work we are putting into the hotel. As you mentioned we are an older property that requires extra care.  Our employees are dedicated to the job and it is reassuring to know that it shows. We are also one of the smaller properties in the area so we are able to spend more time with our guests in helping with any needs that may come up. We hope that you will become one of our many guests that continue to visit us year after year.

Summary: This is a good budget hotel that is near Disneyland, As long as you aren't expecting the Hyatt or other 4-5 star hotel, you will be satisfied.   Pros: Very close to the park. My 10 year old and I walked there in 10 minutes Large bathroom Microwave and fridge Excellent customer service from the friendly front desk staff! Great breakfast selections, including hot items like eggs, sausage, & waffles  Cons: Small parking lot Wifi didn't work half the time (I was too far from the office I think)  Overall, I recommend staying here if you are on a budget and want free parking, wifi, and breakfast included in your rate and the ability to walk to the park.
Manager Response: We appreciate your kind words about our staff. I will be sure that they hear of your review.  I apologize for the wi fi not working during your stay.  We have been working on this for some time and we do have a back up.  I am sorry that we were not able to fix this during your stay. I will talk to our employees about informing everyone about our back up passwords. I hope that this does not prevent you from staying with us in the future.

Summary: this hotel was just right. its about a 10min walk to Disneyland. the breakfast in the moring was nice. the normal cereal, juice, coffee and pastry plus make your own waffles, eggs and sausage. which was wonderful. the rooms are a bit dated and the carpet need some serious cleaning, but the bed was clean. as well as the bathroom, which looked like it had been recently renovated. although when we went to use the shower we had a very hard time pulling up the leaver to get the shower head going. we made a note to someone at the desk. all of the desk/houskeeping  staff the we encountered was very helpful and polite. one of the best things about this hotel is that there is NO RESORT OR PARKING FEES. which is very very nice not having to pay that extra money. we will be staying here
Manager Response: I am so happy that you were able to save those extra dollars with us.  We understand how expensive traveling can be. We may not be able to lower our rates due to the heavy competition in the area but we can cut out those extra charges.  It is always nice to know that we helped out. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: The free breakfast makes it all worth it
Summary: The room itself is ok.  It's starting to show a little age, but they have done some updating.  The bathroom in our room was recently renovated and looked very clean.  We had a 2-queen room (I think most of the rooms are doubles), so we each slept on our own bed.  They are firm, but just the way I like it.  We were on the second floor, but I would not have wanted to be on the first floor because our floor squeaked when we walked on it, even though we were not trying to.  We just paid around 10 bucks extra for the queen room "with balcony" to guarantee an upstairs room.  The best part was the free breakfast.  Consisting of standard pastry/cereal fare, but in addition there was sausage links, hard boiled eggs, egg "patties", and a waffle maker.  Also fruit, yogurt and 2 juices.  It
Manager Response: I appreciate you sharing your stay with us.  I am happy to hear that you enjoyed our breakfast.  We have been trying to add a little something for everyone  Recently we had a request for some sugar free items and added the sugar free syrup for the waffles and the plain oatmeal. .  If you have any suggestions we would love to hear them. Thank you for staying with us, we look forward to seeing you again.

Summary Heading: A diamond in the rough!! We will stay here again and again!!
Summary: My hubby and I took a spur of the moment Disney trip.We landed at this Quality inn.The rooms a bit dated, Very clean and comfortable.fridge/micro inc.The staff fantastic! Hot breakfast buffet style.FREE PARKING/NO RESORT FEE. 5 min walk to inside Disneyland & downtown Disney. We can't figure out why people are saying a 15 minute walk? Spa could have been a bit cleaner/still enjoyed. WE WILL BE BACK!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words.  I apologize for the condition of the spa.  I will make sure to check it twice a day instead of once. We can't wait to have you visit again.

Summary: Good, acceptable hotel if you're on a budget and looking for a hotel close to Disneyland. Adequate sized room, adequate everything. Stayed here for 2 nights. They let us check in early at around 11:30am. They held our luggage for us after we checked out.   It's kind of an older hotel/motel so don't expect anything spectacular. Our room and bathroom was as clean as it can get. No bugs (dead nor alive), no bed bugs. No noise problems (but note that we were very tired from walking around the parks all day). Sheets and towels were also clean. Didn't attempt to walk on the floor barefoot. Everything in the room worked - TV, A/C, hair dryer, microwave, fridge, coffee maker, lights/lamps. Staff were all genuinely friendly and helpful.   Breakfast was adequate - juices, coffee, tea, hot
Manager Response: Thank you for completing this survey. We strive to provide the best possible guest experience and your comments help us evaluate and improve upon our service. We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary: Very very friendly girl at the front desk, day shift. Other staff also friendly. Room was just fine and no complaints, and believe me I have no problem voicing a complaint. It was quiet and bed was comfy. Very peaceful area. Not scary as others had commented. I walked alone to downtown Disney{ took under 15 min} and felt quite safe. I love seeing nice friendly employees who go  out of ther way sometimes for customers. It is almost a rareity these days.Other hotel managers seem to even be aloof and non caring to complaints which is just as bad. But as you can see here on tripadvisor, this manager responds with genuine concern. Let that be a lesson to all other hotel managers!!!You guys really rock. Had a great time there this July!!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your positive feedback. I am happy to hear that you felt safe while staying with us. I believe that some people are not used to the city and so many people . It does take some getting used to. Your safety is top priority to The Quality Inn and the Anaheim Resort. Thank you again for staying with us.

Summary: This hotel has a lot to offer. Near the gate of the Disney Resort, within easy walking distance to Downtown Disney and theme parks, families and couples  would enjoy this facility. A good breakfast, a pool and hot tub. A gem to stay at and very easy rates to live with.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments. It is a pleasure hearing from our guests. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: Our teenage boys don't like sharing a bed. So we chose this motel because they had some rooms with a sleeper sofa. Also, it is within walking distance to Disneyland. Even though we arrived at 9:00am, they let us check in early since our room was clean. We appreciated that. The room was a little musty smelling and could have used a coat of paint. But it seemed clean. The pool area was clean and maintained.  The breakfast was a little cramped, but they did have some outside tables. They offered waffles, eggs, sausage, cereal and toast. The quality of the food was very basic. The "scrambled" eggs were in some kind of preformed half-moon shape.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am happy to hear that we were able to check you in before the 3 PM arrival time. It is not always possible, but we will do everything we can to make this happen.  We are aware of the "cramped" breakfast area. We have been adding tables and have added some outside, but it seems that the more we add, the more people arrive.  As for the breakfast items, we try to provide something for everyone.  Recently we added plain oatmeal and sugarfree syrup for our health concious guests and those who are diabetic. If you have any special requests please contact us with them and we will try to provide any reasonable requests. Thank you for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Nice clean hotel, but had some issues...
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for our Dianeyland trip in june, no kids with us but two other adults on our trip.  The rooms were fairly large n clean, included microwave n small fridge, hair dryer, ironing board, in room safe, and nice flat screen tv!  Pool n hot tub looked very nice bur we didnt try them out.  Free breakfast layout was fairly nice, eggs sausage fruit cereal donuts n pastries n make your waffles. there is also a dennys right next door Small issues we experienced: beacuse of the setup of all rooms around the pool you can hear kids and people yelling all day n we did!  The parking lot is very inconveniently set up so we were lucky to find parking.  The distance of hotels to the DL parks is about a 15min walk to Downtown Disney NOT pedestrian entrance, so we then had to
Manager Response: We have recently changed our breakfast menu and it is nice to hear that you enjoyed it.  I am sorry that you felt the walk to Disneyland was too long for you. It can be a little much after a long day walking at the park. Thank you for your comments.

Summary Heading: Great place for a great price
Summary: We had a great stay - the room was clean, spacious and comfortable, only problem was that you could hear the neighbours who were up early. Breakfast was provided, it was a 15min walk to Disneyland. All staff were friendly. They were happy to hold our bags for us when we arrived early. I highly recommend this place-great value!
Manager Response: I apologize for the noise created by our early risers.  We do try to accommodate everyone and it is hard to keep the children who are excited about their upcoming Disney trip quiet.  It does not happen often, but it does happen.  I am happy everything else went well and we look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: I celebrated a big birthday recently by going to Disneyland. This property was very nice. Rooms were clean, king size bed was very comfortable, quiet, friendly staff, great breakfast, flat screen tv.  I would recommend to anyone going to the Disneyland area.  I would definitely stay at this property again.
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your recent stay with us. We look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Decent place to stay for Disneyland on a budget
Summary: I recently took a trip to Disneyland with family and friends and we decided to stay at this hotel.  It offered free parking, hot continental breakfast, and about a 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland.  I don't believe there was a shuttle to Disneyland from this hotel.  Also, there are no elevators (which I wasn't aware of), so I had a little trouble getting my 1-year old up to our room on the 2nd floor since I like to use her stroller a lot.  However, the front desk attendant was very nice and helped me carry my luggage and the stroller upstairs.  There were a few mishaps when I first checked in.  When I entered my assigned room, it seemed like either the maid didn't clean it, or someone had crashed the room when it should have been unoccupied.  The toilet seat was up, as if a man
Manager Response: I was made aware of the issues regarding you checking in and I apologize for the experience. There is no excuse for the things that happened and I will not try to make one. I just want you to kow that we have solved this from ever happening again. I thank you for bringing to my attention the matter you also had with the tv channels. I am unaware of any xxx channels that are currently available and I have multiple people trying to find out exactly what this could have been. We do not offer any pay per view movies. If you could call the hotel so that we may discuss further the channel so that this will not happen again I would appreciate it. We definately do not wish our guests to have to monitor their childrens television viewing while staying with us. I look forward to your call.

Summary: Stayed at this hotel for a Robotics Competition early up late in. What a deal to wake up get breakfast and come "home" to a clean room and flat screen tv. For a great price. The cleaning staff was professional and thorough. This is an older hotel and we could hear the kids next door but nothing too loud you can't go to sleep. Shannon at the front desk was astounding. She held our luggage after we checked out and went walking around. The landscaping and gardens are beautiful and worth the stay. Thank you Quality inn for making oir trip a great one.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words about your recent stay. I must congratulate your team for coming in first place! We are so proud of all of you and the hard work and dedication that you have shown.  It was a pleasure to have you stay with us and we look forward to another win next year.

Summary Heading: Budget hotel with great location for Disneyland
Summary: This is a basic hotel, nothing fancy, but then who spends a lot of time in their room while visiting Disneyland. It was clean with comfortable beds, microwave and refrigerator. One of our rooms had no hot water the first morning but it was fine the rest of our stay. The room with two queen beds had plenty of room for an inflatable bed. There's no elevator to the second floor. The complimentary breakfast was good. You have some road noise but it dies down at night. It's a 10 minute walk to the Disneyland hotel which leads to both parks so you can take a break mid day if you want to. There is a small store with beverages, snacks and the small foam ice chests you can take into the park right next door along with a Denny's and a great Pizza place.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your comments. We love to hear about all of our guests experiences and are grateful for any suggestions made. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Family of 5 with youngest at 8yrs old. We travel to DLand about every 2-3yrs and have always stayed across the road from the park entrance. The location was great for getting quickly into DLand, however the cost has always been around $130/night. WHen we tried reserving this year, the cost jumped to $180/night. That's why we reserved at the Quality Inn. Initially, we were concerned about the switch because even on a budget, we did not want to be in a bad hotel for 6 nights!! I can tell you, the Quality Inn is every bit as nice as our prior Hotel (Park Place), and a lot less expense. You're not getting DisneyLand quality, but it's a clean hotel and close enough to the park to walk. We spent 6 days at the hotel (daughter had a volleyball tournment for 3 days and we spent 3 days at
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had booked a 3 night stay but left after 1.  We arrived on 03-15 with the intention of going to Disneyland for 2 days.  Upon arrival in our room, we immediately noticed that the carpet was filthy.  There was a crusty white stain on the carpet in front of the refrigerator that I'm hoping was milk.  The carpets were disgusting and felt grimey.  Our feet turned black after less than 5 minutes walking around without our shoes on (this is not an exaggeration).  The room smelled musty.  I notified the front desk of this problem and was told that there were no more rooms and they were sold out.  I immediately cancelled the next 2 nights of our stay. The young man at the front desk tried to explain that possibly the "shampoo was not rinsed out of the carpet completely" when they
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great For Disney Fans on a Budget
Summary: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in January 2012. The lady at the front desk was very helpful and kind in taking our last minute booking when we arrived.  This is a two star hotel. Don't expect anything fancy and you will not be disappointed. We were happy with our accomodation, a room on the ground floor. The bedroom was in need of a makeover, and the wardrobe was broken, but otherwise it was clean and neat. The bathroom was designed for disability access and was huge. It had been recently renovated and looked lovely. The area was quiet and we slept well.  Breakfast is for those who love sugar and carbs. A lot of donuts, and similar pastry products on offer. There was some fruit and yoghurt for healthy choices.  The location is the real key to this hotel. It is across the
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here while in town for business.  I stayed in two different rooms over two separate weeks.  I knew I wasn't staying at the Marriott, so my expectations weren't very high.  This hotel exceeded my expectations! The rooms were clean and provided everything I needed. The breakfast was a decent continental breakfast. The keyword is CONTINENTAL.  If you expect eggs, bacon, sausage, etc., you need to look for a place that provides a HOT breakfast.  I was able to find something to fit my need every morning.  The WiFi signal was poor in the room I was in at the rear of the hotel, which was disappointing.  However, my second room in the front of the hotel had a good WiFi signal.  The pool was heated and comfortable to swim in during the cool winter month.  I would definitely
Manager Response: none

Summary: Okay, I have stayed here before, and Id was very disappointed in them the first time.  But with a big convention in town, this was the only hotel we could find under $100 a night with a breakfast, so we crossed our fingers and gave them another chance.  Overall, pretty good stay.  The pool and hot tub were clean (although there was so much chlorine in the hot tub that my skin felt like it was getting sandpapered off) and our room was very clean and though a little older, pretty well maintained.  The walls are very thin though, so expect to hear every move your neighbors make.  Let's just say I was very grateful that the baby next door didn't start to cry until we were already up.   Staff was nice, the off part was...breakfast.   Okay, first of all, I admit to being on a low carb
Manager Response: I am pleased to announce that our "normal" breakfast is back. We were in the process of adding a kitchen to the property and were temporarily prohibited from serving any food that was prepared. We have completed the project and have now begun serving eggs and sausage once again. This time we added the waffle irons due to many suggestions from our guests. We are also considering breakfast burritos (pending guest feedback). I hope you have the opportunity to visit us again and give us your thoughts about what else we can improve or add.

Summary: Okay, so...I've always been a little skeptical of reviews like this. I work in the hotel business, and I know that you just can't please some people..no matter how hard the hotel tries. So, I tend to be more lenient with the hotels we stay at. I have no problem letting a little dirt slip by, but this place..was by far THE worst place I have ever stayed in. I've traveled all over and stay in hotels quite a bit. More than 5 months total this year....this place was HORRIBLE. We checked in late at night, after a day at Disneyland. The lady at the front desk was very sweet and helpful and gave us a room on the first floor. When we got to the room, I checked the beds, as I always do. Me and my husband's bed had makeup on the pillows and sheets. I called the front desk, and she offered
Manager Response: none

Summary: We orginally booked a different hotel and was quite surprised when we checked in.  We immediately checked out of that hotel and found this Quality Inn & Suites just around the corner.  Celena was very nice and allowed us to take a quick look at the room before making a decision if we wanted to stay or not.  We could not have been happier staying anywhere else.  The room was VERY CLEAN!  Looks like there were some recent upgrades done in the room.  The entire staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  We requested additional towels and they were very prompt in getting the towels to us.  It was within walking distance to Disneyland which was an added plus.  The room we had was with 2 queen beds and a sofa sleeper.  The only downside was the breakfast in the lobby....not enough
Manager Response: We appreciate you staying with us and sharing your comments. I am aware of the breakfast area being crowded in the morning and we are trying to figure out a solution.  We love it that every guest shows up to have the eggs, sausage and waffles in the morning, but it always seems to be at the same time!  We recently added an extra half hour to the breakfast time and it has helped somewhat. We have discussed adding more seating outside and making a garden type area by the pool and playground. Just remember that wherever you eat, make sure you stop by the front desk to say hi.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel on December 6-7, 2011.  I opted for the 1 bedroom suite to give us more space.  I couldn't have been more disappointed in the suite.  First, it's not really a suite--it's just regular room with a very small room attached to it. The extra room has a pull-out couch and a coffee table and that's it.  It has A/C but doesn't have heat.  The room was not that clean--the carpets were pretty dirty and the linens didn't seem all that clean either.   I slept on the pull-out couch and it was not comfortable.  It's probably the cheapest and most uncomfortable pull-out bed I've ever slept on.  The manager at the front desk was friendly and the breakfast was average.  They had eggs and sausage that we stuck between toast to make a sandwich.  They had 3 cereal choices,
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here from October 8 - 15.  The rooms are fine.  If you are very fussy, look elsewhere.  If you want a comfortable room, within walking distance, this will be fine. When we first opened the door, there was a strong perfumey smell which gave way to an old smell as the week went on. The room was small, but it had a fridge and microwave and comfortable beds.  The bathroom counter is very small and behind the door to the bathroom door so a little inconvenient. The courtyard was lovely and the breakfast was good. The pool looked lovely but the water was cold.  Only used it for a few minutes one afternoon as it was so cold. The people at the desk were lovely and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is not fussy! We had a great deal and would stay here again for
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  I am sorry that you experienced a musty smell in the room.  We have recently had the carpets cleaned and am sure that the rooms are more pleasant now. As for the pool, we adjusted the temperature a few degrees and we now have a crowd almost every night  swimming!  We look forward to seeing you on your next trip.

Summary: Clean, attractive, and well located, within a 20-min walk to Disneyland. Nice little touches - glowing light switches, in-room safe, pretty fan-folded towels, and sturdy work desk. Good breakfast assortment and quantity.   I would have been very pleased with my stay if it wasn't for a string of problems - broken coffee maker, broken shower curtain bar (curtain sagging, touching the floor), and broken Internet. None of these problems were initially resolved after contacting the front desk, until I took it up with a manager on my 4th day there.   The Internet outage was really bad because I was on business, and different front desk staff denied there were Internet problems for three days. Finally, the 4th day, a new front desk guy admitted there were persistent issues, and the
Manager Response: What you experienced dealing with the front desk was unacceptable. I have changed the way information is shared among our employees and this will not happen again. We now have new owners who will make sure these problems are dealt with immediately. We hope you give us another chance to show you all of our improvements.
